review: From the time we pulled up, the parking gentleman was so friendly and informative. The check in very pleasant with Nathan, to our bellman with tips on where to eat and very welcoming. Then, we ran into Nathan again!!! He was at the beach cabana giving out towels!! My husband asked him about renting a beach bike. We had just walked back into our room and our phone was ringing... You guessed it!!! It was Nathan !!! He had all the information and more. We hope he's recognized as an exemplary employee. Somebody that should be a role model to others!! The hotel itself was nice. We had a 1 bedroom ocean front suite. Mini fridge, dishwasher, microwave,  seperate living room, dining area, bedroom.....amazing balcony and view.

title: Nice place - but could be better
review: Dear BeachGirlDawne,  We couldn’t be more flattered to read your review. It’s wonderful that Nathan had such a positive impact on your stay and was able to provide you with some local recommendations. I look forward to sharing your kind words with him and hope you come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Beachfront, nice rooms, great staff!
review: Stayed here as a couple over Labor Day weekend.  The hotel this weekend was unsurprisingly full yet check in was swift and we did not encounter any issues getting parked in the parking lot.  The rooms are excellent - we had a suite on the 12th floor with excellent views of the Gulf.  The rooms are clean, tidy & have everything you need for your stay. The only negative with the hotel was that we found the pool area to be packed out during the day - with people drinking & smoking which we found off putting.  Sure, have a beer at your sunbed, but the hotel should impose some stricter rules for those that want to relax in the water.  There is a large (and decent) bar next to the pool for drinks & smokes. The above aside, we would stay again.  The walk into Fort Myers Beach…

title: Getaway
review: Dear TukTuk180,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead and taking a moment to share your comments with us. We’re glad you enjoyed our accommodations and beautiful views of the Gulf. I do apologize for any frustrations you encountered with other guests around the pool. We hope to see you the next time you’re in Fort Myers Beach!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: It is an option
review: We stayed here for our anniversary and greatly enjoyed the hotel. The room had a great view of the gulf, and was very large! Staff was nice, attentive and helpful. Is a little long walk to Times Square and restaurants, but do-able. In house restaurants are ok, but it is worth heading out elsewhere to eat. Overall an enjoyable beachfront place to stay on vacation.

title: Beautiful rooms with everything you need in walking distance
review: Really nice spacious rooms, I loved how the living room and bedroom area were two separate rooms, but have a joined balcony to view the water. The bathrooms have two doors - one for the bedroom and one for the living room, the kitchen also has a lot more than I expected! They leave you with a set of cups, plates, and bowls... A dishwasher with soap to clean too! If you don't like the dishwasher, there's a sink if you prefer that. With a coffee maker and fridge to boot, it's pretty comfortable to stay there! The living room and bedroom have their own TV, and the couch pulls out to an extra bed as well (extra linens and pillow in the closet).  They do charge $10 for parking, but give you a $10 voucher when you eat at their restaurant (try the Mongolian shrimp at Cabana's -…

title: Very nice hotel, great room, only had one little problem
review: Dear DJ R,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead and taking the time to provide us with a review. We’re delighted to hear you enjoyed our fully appointed accommodations and  property amenities. It’s great that you were able to dine at Cabanas while visiting. We appreciate your feedback and look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Nice hotel right on the beach
review: We really enjoyed our stay at DiamondHead.  Upon check-in our room was upgraded to an ocean view, which was very nice.  The room is a great size, and was very clean.  The pool is a little small for such a big resort, but we were there in the off season (August), so it wasn't much of an issue.  It was annoying that Chloe's lounge wasn't open during the week, but again, I suppose this was due to being a slow part of the year for the resort. Overall, we really had a good time. The staff was incredibly friendly, and the food was very good. If I was rating the staff alone, they would receive 5 stars.  My one gripe is that there was a rather large cockroach in our room on the last day. When we checked out, I alerted the front desk, but she really didn't seem to care all that much. …

title: Didn't want to leave!!!!
review: Dear Eric W,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead and taking a moment to share your comments with us. We’re thrilled to hear you enjoyed your time at our resort and had a great experience with our friendly staff. I do apologize for the incident you encountered on your last day. This is certainly not typical of our establishment. Please feel free to reach out to me directly to discuss this further. We appreciate your feedback and hope you come back and see us again soon.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: A hidden gem
review: We stayed for two nights during the low season of August. There were rarely more than 10 people on the beach or at the pool, and we loved that! The poolside cabana bar was a nice surprise- tasty quesadillas with chicken and pineapple and lots of tasty drink options (try the lime aid frozen cocktail). The hotel is centrally located near many restaurants and bars. We received a call before our stay about a timeshare presentation, politely declined, and were never asked about it again while on property. All in all, a great place to spend some time in he sun.

title: Dealer Weekend
review: Have stayed at this hotel many times and it has always been a great experience. The staff is very friendly and hotel is clean. The rooms are big like a 2 room suite with king size bed and nice living room area.

title: Great views and wonderful beach
review: Dear Laura H,  Thanks so much for the kind words. We couldn’t be happier to hear you’ve stayed at our hotel several times and have continuously had great experiences. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we look forward to welcoming you back in the near future.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Eweeeee
review: I stayed at this hotel in September 2014 when I was on my way from Key West to Orlando. So, in a nutshell: 1. Great views from the balcony (although the net placed for whatever purpose is a pain in the b...) 2. Wonderful beach. In September, almost deserted... :-) 3. Nice pool, rather on the small side and somewhat crowded. 4. Room decoration straight out of the 70's 5. Large and confortable beds.

title: Can't wait to return!
review: Dear DecoBraga,  Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. I’m glad you enjoyed the beach and beautiful views from the lanai. We hope you come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Absolutely great
review: After comparing prices between Pink Shell and Diamondhead Resorts in Ft. Myers Beach, FL, my husband and I decided to give Diamondhead a try. Even though we love the Pink Shell, we thought with a savings of over $100 a night, it would be worth it. WRONG!  At first glance, the hotel looked really nice, great staff, nice beach... we were even "upgraded" to a better room. The room was decorated nice, but wasn't the view we had been told we had reserved.  We ended up with partial gulf views and right over the very loud pool & bar area. After the 1st night of Karoke, I asked to be moved to a different room. They agreed to move us for the 3rd & 4th nights. Great view & decorated just like the 1st room. As we were packing up to leave, and moved some of the pillows, we discovered what…

title: Diamond Vacation
review: Great customer service from everyone that works there.  Best drink menu we have ever seen at the ticki bar!  Cloes restaurant was good, they have outside seating but not during the summer we were told.  If not raining they should reconsider the outside seating with the awesome views of the ocean.

title: We were there for our anniversary.
review: Dear Rodney D,  Thanks so much for the fantastic review! We’re thrilled to hear you had an exceptional vacation and enjoyed dining at Chloes and Cabanas. I must agree that Cabanas does have an excellent, diverse drink menu, perfect for a warm day on the beach. We appreciate your feedback and hope you return soon.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: The best hotel on FM Beach~!
review: We had a great time. Pool was always clean and cool. Beach was clean, beach water was muddy looking though. No reflection on hotel since that was nothing they had control of. staff was great! Room was cleaned daily with a newspaper always waiting outside the door in the morning. Nice balcony with table and chairs.

title: My wonderful stay at DiamondHead Beach Resort Hotel
review: Dear Debbie Z,  Thanks so much for the excellent review! We’re so glad you chose DiamondHead to celebrate your anniversary and that you had a wonderful visit. Come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Really Love This Place!
review: Jaime & Nathan at front desk helped me with a credit card issue flawlessly. I was embarrassed because I used a card that had some recent major home repairs outstanding on it...upon meeting my husband at the beach bar for my first cocktail, my husband made me go fix it. They did not hesitate to be as kind to me as possible & help fix my mistake & keep me out of trouble with the husband~! I am pretty sure Kathy even had to fax my bank to release the hold. I was so grateful that I relaxed & was able to enjoy the whole weekend. Johnny & Marcel executed an awesome wedding & even the parking attendant was welcoming & endearing. He has a very tough job but it a great first greeting upon pulling in at Diamondhead~!

title: perfect place to stay
review: love this hotel it's SUPER clean & has the best views. pool and hot tubs were very nice. very nice staff. we will be back! the only thing i didn't like was the beach had a lot of seaweed & the water is not clear (which has nothing to do with hotel)  they have everything you would want or need here!

title: Weekend Getaway
review: Dear Brook P,  Thank you for taking the time to share your experience with us. We’re thrilled to hear our resort was the perfect destination for your vacation. We hope you come back and stay with us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Diamondhead beach resort
review: We love Diamond Head.  We've been going there for a few years now.  The rooms are great, all with ocean view.  We love the Cabana and pool area right on the beach. We have just bought a week there every year and are waiting to return there next month.  It is a wonderful vacation getaway.

title: Wonderful!
review: Dear Dolly W,  Thanks for taking the time to review your stay at DiamondHead. Nothing makes us happier than a satisfied guest! We’re so glad you enjoyed our accommodations and beachfront location. We look forward to welcoming you back next month!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Very nice clean hotel
review: We have stayed here the past several years.  The rooms are consistently clean and nicely appointed.  The screened lanai allows you to enjoy the view without worrying about bugs.  I highly recommend Chloe's restaurant.  Try the Sanibel pepper jelly with the coconut bread.

title: Amazing
review: This is a great stay if you want a great family friendly place and if you want access to almost everything the hotel is in a prime location and they have a hut to fix things like goggles u can buy them or sunscreen or rent a towel the employees r very nice

title: Can't ask for anything else!
review: Dear Peter G,  Thank you for taking a moment to leave a review on your recent stay at DiamondHead. It’s wonderful to hear you enjoyed our family-friendly atmosphere and convenient location on Fort Myers Beach. We hope we have the chance to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Wonderful stay,
review: The DiamondHead has been great from the first day they opened! It has all the room and amenities a family needs, food, drink and pool fun! directly on the beach LOVE IT with a fair price to boot! All views are great-we always stayed on the 10th floor, the only view that isnt the hottest is the bay view. But who cares? Who's looking out that way when your playing ON the Beach!

title: Weekend
review: Dear S L,  Thanks so much for the fantastic review! We’re so happy you enjoyed our property amenities, from the dining to the pool. Being so close to us in North Fort Myers, we hope you come back and see us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Great time @ DiamondHead & Exceptional Customer Service
review: Great stay ! Room very clean! Service was great ! Will stay again! No problems all week.  We were in town for the baseball tournament . Very easy to get to the fields from  this beautiful hotel . Pool was very clean . Loved the wrist bands that served as room key ,entrance to pool , elevators after hours.family friendly.

title: Beautiful
review: Our family loves staying at the diamondhead.  Perfect location and family friendly.   They do have a spa located right on the premises but its very small.  Great staff though..  very accommodating! Its located right off the beach and is a great place to relax and vacation.   So much to do on ft myers beach.   Perfect place

title: Great Week!
review: Dear Jennifer R,  Thank you so much for the kind words. I’m so glad you had an excellent experience at DiamondHead and enjoyed every aspect of our resort. Come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Chloes
review: My son and I stayed at this hotel for a baseball tournament with 12 other families. They had rules for the boys behavior, restaurants were great and not overpriced, staff were friendly and accommodating. The rooms do not have a stove, we brought a single burner so we could cook in the room. Great pool & beach. Walking distance to other restaurants and shopping. My only complaint would be non English speaking housekeeping attendants, little hard to ask questions.

title: Wonderful weekend at Diamondhead
review: Dear Dolphinheadkw,  Thank you so much for the kind words. I’m happy to hear you had a wonderful stay at DiamondHead and received exceptional customer service. We hope you have the chance to come back and visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Diamondhead has it all, at a great location
review: Spike in Choles Lounge  made the best chocolate martini and was only four dollars.  We ate in the upstairs dining room and the food was excellent. Had a coupon for free entree. Did not stay at the hotel but went back the next night.

title: Family Vacation
review: I found this to be a beautiful, clean, and relaxing resort. The staff is incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. There are fun scheduled activities for the family and some just for kids. (It is subject to change though.) The food is good all around but some items are pricey. I would come back.

title: Overall Great Stay
review: Dear J N,  Thank you so much for the wonderful feedback. I’m thrilled to hear you had an excellent experience and you’re already thinking about a second trip. We can’t wait to welcome you back soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Great Hotel, Excellent Location on the Beach
review: We stayed 7 nights at DiamondHead Resort and really enjoyed our time. As with all places, there are pros and cons.  Pros – The views are spectacular and as far as I could tell, there wouldn’t be a bad view in the place. The suites are spacious and very clean. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The kitchenette is perfect for snacks and beverages if you’re planning to eat all of your meals out. I wouldn’t want to prepare food in the small space. The patios are huge and wonderful! The beach was well-kept. Lots of water activities offered – for a cost of course. The location of the resort is excellent – close enough to Times Square to walk but far enough that the beach is relatively quiet. The pool was very clean and fun – not too loud at night. Great place for couples or…

title: Getaway from the cold visit
review: Dear LPVacation2014,  Thank you for putting so much time into providing a detailed review. I’m so glad you had a wonderful stay and you’re already planning another visit. I apologize if the bedding did not meet your expectations, but we appreciate you voicing these concerns so that we can take this into consideration as we look to make future improvements. Thanks again for the detailed feedback. We look forward to welcoming you back soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Annual Family Visit
review: Diamondhead Beach resort and spa is an excellent hotel right on Ft. Myers Beach.    This hotel offers parasailing, jet skiing, volleyball, beach chair rentals all from one location.     With a family of 4, this has been our second trip to this hotel and plan to return for a third trip.

title: Great stay for a Family reunion
review: Ok so I went here for a family reunion and was very pleased with the experience.  It has a very laid back environment which I was happy about.  It was very nice, but not over the top which I was thankful for.  The food was very good at their restaurant.  It is also not far from what I consider the main attraction of the area, sanibel island. Also they have a big kitchen in most of the rooms and the rooms face the ocean which is absolutely lovely.  The grounds are also very nice and well maintained.  The thing I liked most about this place was that they gave you your space and independence while taking great care of you and ensuring you have everything you need and the price was not ridiculous.  I would definitely go back for a great get away with just enough, but not too much…

title: Perfect for extended family birthday celebration
review: Dear kasitravels,  Thank you so much for your kind words. I’m thrilled you had a wonderful experience at DiamondHead for your family reunion. I’m also glad you had the chance to dine at one of our onsite restaurants and enjoyed the food. Come visit us again soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Worth the money
review: Family members from six states converged upon this resort to celebrate my husband's birthday at the end of May.  We worked with their caterer to have a reception and dinner on their patio and function room.  We reserved many rooms with some complicated arrangements and it all went smoothly.  The cabana's accessibility made it easy for family members to interact throughout the weekend.  Many of us took advantage of hot tub, pool, and direct entrance to the cool sands and beach.  A small negative was extremely slow service in the cabana.  But, all in all, it was an especially enjoyable stay for everyone.

title: Perfect Family Getaway
review: Dear Gloria P,  Thanks so much for choosing our resort to celebrate your husband’s birthday and taking the time to provide us with a wonderful review. I’m so glad everything went smoothly. Let us know whenever you will be back in town. We would love to provide another amazing experience with a second visit!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Awesome!!!
review: We loved our stay. I'm very picky and this hotel was excellent. Very CLEAN, good sized room, and comfortable bed. The pictures are as it is! Enjoyed the Cabana Bar and we ate with our feet in the sand. Beach was lovely. Great view from our gulf view large balcony. Excellent staff as well.

title: Great Vacation
review: This was my first trip to Fort Myers and to Diamondhead Beach Resort.  The room was very clean, spacious, and nicely decorated. We forgot beach towels, but no worry they were furnished at pool side.  The food was very good, a little pricey but worth it.  The staff were very friendly.  Kudos to the concierge staff, they were awesome.  They made you feel so very welcomed.  Bikes were offered at free of charge also.  A staff member mentioned that the rates would be higher next year due to renovations.  I certainly hope not too much.  Overall experience was a great one. Loved the atmosphere at the poolside dining area.  Live music in the evenings.

title: Awesome!
review: Dear PenPen55,  Thank you so much for your kind words. We very much appreciate it, and will surely share your praise with our concierge staff. Please come back and visit soon!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Good Trip
review: We return every year to DiamondHead Beach Resort! Outstanding and friendly staff. Clean spacious rooms overlooking the pool and gulf beach. Great location....within walking distance to the square and pier. Wonderful vacation. Highly recommended.

title: Everything great but the stingrays!
review: Dear Kim S,  Thank you so much for the wonderful review and choosing our hotel to visit year after year. We can’t wait to welcome you back in the near future!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Anniversary Celebration
review: Wife and I had a good trip to the Diamond Head resort.  Nice beach the food is a little pricey but expected.  I am a handicapped Vet from Iraq war in 03 there is not many handicapped spaces at the hotel.  They do a bad job of making sure those spaces are for the needy.  There are 6 spaces and one night after coming back from dinner with family all spaces were taken 5 spaces were of no handi cap placards what so ever on cars. So it was a long strol to my room. That is really my only complaint other than that had a great time......

title: Very enjoyable visit
review: We stayed in an 11th floor apartment overlooking the ocean.  The balcony had a table and lounge chairs and had a very unobtrusive netting to keep bugs and mosquitoes out -- this was genius!  Sitting out there reading my kindle, I felt very close to the beach since I could hear the ocean and see the people on the beach while being sheltered from the sun.  There is also a pool.    There is a television in the living room and another one in the bedroom.  Access to the balcony from the living room and bedroom.  You certainly could make meals in the kitchen if so inclined although I was not!  Useful if you are travelling with kids.  There a lot of activities on the beach.  You can parasail, jet ski, etc for a price of course.  I certainly  would return on Diamondhead.  The staff all…

title: Beautiful view
review: My husband and I stayed at the Diamondhead over Memorial Day Weekend 2015.  We were given an upgraded accommodation facing the Gulf of Mexico and with a view of the pool.  Our accommodation was clean and comfortable, and we thoroughly enjoyed eating breakfast and our room service meal on our screened in balcony.   The balcony was huge and spanned the length of the entire unit.  It included a big table and two lounge chairs.  It was a thoroughly soothing and relaxing experience.  The bellman and front desk employees were very friendly and terrific.  I would recommend this place.

title: Expensive but nice room
review: Dear Patricia K,  Thank you so much for taking the time to share your experience with us. I’m so glad you chose our resort to celebrate Memorial Day Weekend and were able to stay in an upgraded unit with that amazing view of the Gulf. I’m also happy to hear that you enjoyed our relaxing balcony and received excellent customer service from the bellman and front desk staff. They work very hard to ensure all of our guests have an exceptional stay. Thanks again for the wonderful feedback. We hope you have the chance to visit us again in the near future!  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: wedding on the beach
review: My husband and I stayed 4 nights here in May. We were in 508 which they said was just redone. We also paid extra for a premium room. The room was very nice and updated. There's a kitchen with everything you need even a dishwasher. There's a blender, dishes etc. The screened in balcony was huge. King size bed was comfortable.  As other reviews state housekeeping came late in the day but was friendly.  The beach is very nice.  Shallow water until you get way out there. I think it's ridiculous you have to pay $30 a day for beach chairs and an umbrella.  Plus at 5 pm they close , so you have to get out of chairs so they can put them away.     Our last night was  a Friday and we paid  $399 a night.  I think they should throw in the chairs for the high price of the room. Another…

title: Nice resort
review: Dear Nikkir98,  Thank you for taking the time to share a review on your experience.  I’m happy that you chose to stay at our resort and enjoyed our newest renovated Premium Beachfront unit. I’m also thrilled to hear that you took advantage of the beach sport rentals. The Jet Ski dolphin tour is one of my favorites!   I apologize for any inconvenience with the beach chair rentals. Unfortunately, as these are rented through an outside company, we do not have control over prices or policies.  I’m disappointed to hear about the experience you had with the towel hut employee, but I certainly hope our team was able to address your concerns. If there is anything else we can do to make it up to you, please don’t hesitate to reach back out to us. We appreciate your feedback and hope you have the chance to visit us again in the future so we can exceed your expectations.   Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Wonderful Location and a Million Dollar View
review: This was our second visit to DiamondHead Beach Resort and although both visits were pleasant, the first was much better due to a much nicer room location. Beachfront or Eastern view at this particular resort is much nicer. Our Western view room this time overlooked several other motel rooftops with loud A/C units and the ones for our hotel were also below our room. It made sitting on the balcony less enjoyable because of the noise.    I will also state that the personnel that work at that resort were perhaps the most pleasant and helpful bunch I have ever encountered in all my traveling experience the last forty years or so.    I did not eat at the main restaurant but had drinks and an app in the bar and it was fine. The pool area is roomy and well maintained; towel service and…

title: Perfect location, perfect beach and great views!
review: Took a short family vacation to FMB and was lucky enough to score this hotel. We went in the middle of May so things were quiet and we had ocean front view. I can't imagine a view better than what we had. Diamondhead has a restaurant/bar at the pool called the cabana, chloes lounge and also chloes restaurant. We had no reason to leave! Rooms were more than sufficient for size, offered King bed with pull out in the living room. Kitchen with microwave, mini-fridge, toaster, coffee maker and dishwasher. Less than 1/2 mile from Pier and restaurants/activities. Also less than 1/2 mile in other direction from Topps grocery store. We LOVED our time here and would definitely stay here if we return to Fort Myers Beach.

title: nice place right on beach
review: very clean place the rooms were nice and the views were great from balcony..Had breakfast at the resort and it was terrible they need to learn what French toast is. They gave me a cinn bun and said it was French toast and it was still frozen terrible. The bar by the pool was very nice with great staff that really knew the area.To much drinking going on around the pool area . Woke up early to take a walk on beach and all you could see was empty or broken beer bottles all over the place even on the beach not very nice for a resort to allow that to happen on or near there grounds

title: This hotel is right on the beach!
review: Dear gambler599,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort and providing us with your comments. I’m glad you enjoyed the cleanliness of our accommodations, our beautiful beachfront location and the service you received while staying with us. However, I’m sorry to hear that the breakfast did not meet your expectations. I’m also disappointed to hear about the condition of the beach during your walk; please note this is not typical for our area beaches. Thank you again for providing us with your feedback.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Great weekend getaway!
review: This hotel is 5 star in every way! Their employees are all upbeat and helpful, the food is good, the location is excellent, and the rooms are fantastic with balconies,  most with an ocean view.  It is classy, yet very laid back. There is EVERYTHING to do! Parasailing, relaxing on the beach or by the pool. We rented a boat not too far away which was a great experience. The whole area is a pleasure to go to, really.

title: High School Gymnastics Nationals
review: This is a great place to stay.  The hotel staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming.  The wait staff at the restaurant and bars are great as well, not to mention the bell hop "guys."  The hotel is very clean, tasty food and awesome beach front location.  This is our host hotel for our Senior Showcase Invitational(Nationals) for the last several years and they are great!!

title: Perfect in Every Detail
review: Just got back from a 2 night stay for my wife's birthday. Rooms are very clean and views are great. We also had breakfast, lunch, and dinner at the Cabana Bar and Grill and Chloe's. Both were excellent. The grouper sandwhich is off the charts good (should have ordered another). My wife had the chicken sandwhich and it was a home run. Breakfast with the check in coupon is $6.95 (two eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage. potatoes). Staff is very accommodating even on holiday week-ends.  We have stayed here in the past and it gets better every year. Really dig this place.

title: Absolutely Fabulous!
review: This was my 6th year at the DiamondHead for business. It never fails to impress me how amazing the staff is. Yes, the room are lovely, yes, the view is great, yes, the beach is awesome. But all of that could be ruined by a rude or inattentive staff. I believe the DiamondHead goes above and beyond to make sure they hire all of the very best available in service staff! Thanks again for a great time!!

title: Wonderful Staff
review: We stayed again this year after spending some time on Sanibel.  From the time you drive in the bell hop was on top of things.  Our room wasn't ready so he took our bags and small amount of soda and food, told us to enjoy and he would come find us at the pool when the room was ready.  That he did, we relaxed, enjoyed the sun and he brought us down our welcome package and 'key/fob' for the room.  Everything was up in the room ready for us and he put all the items in the mini fridge too!  The hotel is clean, well cared for, the pool is small but beautiful, the views from the room were fantastic!  But the staff is what makes this hotel shine!

title: Super Vacation
review: This resort is a  premiere place to spend a vacation. The location and amenities are great. It is situated a short walk from Times Square & the Pier. The beach is clean and lovely for walks. They have both a dining room & a beach side restaurant and bar. The staff is exemplorary from the front desk to the concierges.. Can't wait to go back.

title: Nice room with a view
review: The hotel was very clean and the staff were extremely attentive.  Our room was spacious and clean as well.  Anytime you passed a staff person, you were always greeted with a hello and asked how your stay was going.  We enjoyed a few meals and drinks at Cabanas and breakfast at Chloes.  The food at Cabanas was very good.  A word of caution...do not park under the olive trees.  I have a white car that had yellow spots all over it after a rain storm.  The manager offered to reimburse me to have it washed, but I did not want to spend my time finding a car wash.  The gym was satisfactory.  We enjoyed a couple of our afternoons on the balcony overlooking the ocean.  The bed was OK, and they could have used a little more variety in pillow selection. The room was not cleaned until 3:00…

title: Great, relaxing trip!
review: Nice place, would totally come back. My husband and I had a great time. Room was nice and clean. Spike at Chloe's lounge was a awesome bartender. Beach was nice and close to the resort. Spa was also nice, would recommend. Honestly have no complaints.

title: We didn't want to leave!!
review: My husband and I stayed at the Diamondhead for 8 nights.  Our gulf view suite was very nice, very comfortable.  The staff was very friendly especially the front desk & bellmen.  We took advantage of the bicycles that  are free to guest of the hotel. The location on the beach is perfect. The only negatives, we were not not impressed with our dinner at Chloes, just mediocre food which was a shame because we ate there our first night and never again. Also the fee of $30 for an umbrella and chair for the beach is a bit much.  We stayed at the Hilton on Marco Island last year and you got the chairs free and paid $15.00 if you want an umbrella.   Other than that it was wonderful!!!   We will return...

title: Great getaway
review: This hotel is awesome, in the right place on the beach...not too busy, but not too far away from the action. The rooms are always clean and nice....with a GREAT beachfront rooms, with GREAT views! It's a must to go down to the pool area, and have a drink at the bar. Joe is one of the bartenders at the pool bar, he's pretty funny and serves his drinks with a smile!

title: Anniversary celebration.
review: My husband and I celebrated our 30th wedding anniversary. From all the places we had to choose from, this one was the best. The staff made our anniversary memorable. The activities were abundant. The food was delicious. The room had a wonderful view. (overlooking the beach, from the 8th floor). Watching the sunset while walking on the beach. Jennifer the bartender was very nice. I would recommend the Diamond Head Beach Resort Hotel for any occasion.

title: Celebrated a 50th Birthday with a group of friends and family
review: Diamond Head Beach Resort was a terrific place to enjoy a short vacation with family and friends.  The staff was great, the hotel was clean and the amenities were great.  A great value for the money.  I went there to celebrate my 50th birthday and took 17 people along with me.  We all had a blast and everyone was happy and very satisfied with the accommodations.  The hotel is within walking distance to all of the restaurants and bars in the center square area of town.  The food at Chloe's restaurant at the resort was so good. We had 18 people for dinner and no one walked away hungry or disappointed.  I would give this resort a solid A.  Only one minor complaint, the maid did not refill the toilet paper in the bathroom.  I would definitely stay here again.

title: Best hotel at Ft. Myers Beach!
review: We have been staying at Diamondhead for over 20 years and it just keeps getting better. They have renovated their rooms and they are stunning. The screened in full-size balcony is an added plus for families!  The beach is large and steps away from your room. Every room has a view. The food is delicious and eating out by the beach is great. The friendliness of the entire staff makes you feel welcome and you will come back again.

title: Cloe's Lounge
review: Just wanted to let you know that you have a very special employee in Spike in Cloe's Lounge. We have been coming to Ft Myers Beach for many years and have had the pleasure of staying at Diamond Head. We now stay for at least 3 months, Jan - March, therefore we are in a condo up the beach. In all these years, we have been "regulars" at Cloe's four or five nights a week and have always been amazed with the professional and efficient way in which Spike handles the totally packed lounge by herself (especially on Karaoke night)! We have always told all our friends, old and new, how much fun we have and of course will continue to spread the word. Our plans are to visit for many more years to come and will always look forward to seeing and having a very enjoyable and fun time with…

title: Nice venue for a destination wedding!
review: We were guests at a wedding and stayed two additional nights to explore the beach and surrounding sites.  The room was spacious, a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker accommodated our in-room beverages and snacks.  The outdoor deck is screened for insects and birds -- absolutely lovely.

title: Beautiful, gulffront views
review: We stayed at the Diamondhead Beach Resort Hotel during a recent spring break trip to the Fort Myers area to take in a couple of baseball spring training games.  This is a well-kept, lovely resort with full amenities.  The beach was beautiful, though the water is very shallow for quite some distance from shore.  It would be wonderful for families with small children. Our suite was well appointed, with a full kitchen, and the balcony was amazing.  It was totally screened in, and yet that didn't interfere with our enjoyment of the view and the gulf breezes.  Without exception, the staff seemed  friendly and helpful; we enjoyed drinks at the bar and breakfast in the hotel restaurant.  All in all, a delightful stay.  One thing to note - most of the hotels and restaurants are either…

title: Surpassed all expections, beautiful hotel and experience
review: I came to the Diamondhead Beach Resort because I tried to stay at the Pink Shell and it was just too expensive.  For some reason, comparing it to the Pink Shell, I had low expectations.  But the resort was fantastic!  Every aspect was wonderful.  My room had a marvelous view of the beach and the pool.  The units are big with a separate bedroom and very comfy bed.  The kitchenette was great.  The balcony was extensive.  The restaurants were good, the pool was great and the wait service around the pool was wonderful.  Best of all, the prices for food and drinks were super reasonable for a beach resort.  A great breakfast special of eggs, pancakes, and meet was $6.95.  Ive paid three times that in other resorts.  the drink prices were reasonable too.  it was a nice walk along the…

title: The best place to stay on ft myers beach
review: This resort is a 20 min cab ride from airport u don't need a car , there are $1 shuttles all over or a $5 cab ride usually we just walk everything u need is on the strip.  The people at the diamond head are so helpful for anything u need . Just ask and they have the answer. Rooms are beautiful all are ocean view . Food and drinks at the cabanas bar by the pool were outstanding ! Prices are reasonable if u r looking at south fla u have to book here it's so easy and relaxing

title: Ms.
review: I loved this place! I was a little unsure at first because it is an older establishment and the decor reflects that but after settling in I really loved it! it has a great location. The parking is a little tough so once you get a spot don't give it up. Or you can park at the sister property 2 small blocks away. Everything you need is in walking distance. The kitchenette is great for families. It would have been nice to have a little bigger fridge but other than that it was perfect!

title: Excellent!
review: Thank you Diamondhead Beach Resort! We wrote a review last year regarding our previous visits as owners and have to provide anyone who is thinking about visiting and possibly investing in this property. Please do!! The managemet DOES listen to the owners and to the vacationers when it comes to recommendations to improve the property! We suggested an update to the fitness room and they delivered! New equipment and a larger space to enjoy a morning workout are greatly appreciated. Thanks so much!

title: Very nice time with overall great service
review: Just returned from a lovely vacation with my (adult) daughter. This hotel (trip) had more hits than misses. I will try to be objective.  We reserved a taxi to the hotel since we did not rent a car. You don't need to do this in advance. There is a taxi stand outside the airport that will take you to the Diamondhead for $50. We had a nice 1 hour drive, complete with a taxi driver/tour guide. It was a  longer tri[p because of the "Shrimp Festival" taking place at the beach.  Upon arrival we were greeted by a friendly bellman. Upstairs we checked in and gave a credit card for the balance of the hotel stay. We were not told that they added another $50 per day for incidentals. I brought this to the attention of the front desk...they apologized for the confusion. The $15 resort fee is…

title: Nice accomodation with beautiful view
review: Just returned from a week at Diamondhead.  It is a nice place with a beautiful white sand beach and stunning views of the Gulf and sunsets.  We had dolphins pass by the hotel every day that we were there.   All of the rooms are a 1 bedroom suite with a nice sized living area and kitchenette.  They are very clean and comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful, and those at Cabanas are absolutely the best!  It is conveniently located close enough to time square that you can walk there but far enough away that you are not bothered by it.  This was our first visit to Fort Myers Beach.  The area is very busy with bumper to bumper traffic much of the day so it is not a place to come and go from but it is a nice place to go and mostly stay.  There is a lot to do on the island and…

title: Fort Myers March 2015
review: We were at Diamondhead Resort from 3/9/2015 - 3/16/2015.  The location is nice.  The beach is amazing.  Our room was on the 12th floor facing West - score!  The downside is the house keeping.  We had to wait until after 4pm to get to our room on the first day (Monday).  The next day (Tuesday), the maid didn't show until after 3:30.  On Wednesday AM, we went to the front desk and mentioned a few items that needed to be addressed (light bulb over shower was out, the TV in the bedroom didn't work correctly) and specifically asked that we have house keeping come to our room between 11 & 2 for the remainder of our stay. The front desk was very attentive.  They wrote this down for house keeping and assured us everything would be taken care of.   We were very happy that we were heard. …

title: Gorgeous view and wonderful stay!
review: You can't beat the Gulf views from Diamondhead--especially the Beachfront rooms!!!  The oversized, private balconies were so awesome as were the amenities in our suite and all over the facility!  The staff were focused on pleasing and providing a wonderful stay for us.  The sand was pure white and extremely clean and attractive for walking on at any time of the day.  The mattress in our room was a little on the soft side, but extremely nice!  The kitchenette had everything that we needed to cook for and serve four guests.  There is a grocery store within walking distance and a larger one to drive to.  We did not sleep on the pull-out couch, so we don't know how well that sleeps.  Our spa experience was wonderfully relaxing.  The dinners at both Choe's and Cabanas were delicious!…

title: Sleeping to the sound of the waves
review: Our room had a huge balcony looking right at the beach and ocean.  Great room, even better view.  Centrally located on the island.  Easy walking to Time Square, restaurants, grocery, and of course no walk to the ocean!!  The food there was good too.

title: Overpriced
review: We paid $469/night for a basic two room suite tucked into the Vcorner of the building.  There was no special feeling at check in after a grueling trip with horrible traffic.  The staff was completely uncaring.  We waited 15 minutes at the bar while our room was being readied just to get a menu. Took a trip to the bar later where I was ignored, the front desk for change, and two different floors just to buy 2 bottles of water from a vending machine.   The room was well furnished and clean.  But hotel staff had several opportunities to see me as a tired disgruntled traveler and offer attention...No one cared! Gail, the restaurant manager did hear about being ignored at the bar and personally brought us a $25 restaurant gift card.  She and Matt in the restaurants were great as was…

title: Nice stay, interesting costs
review: All in all it's a wonderful place, however, some costs seem a little odd. $15 convenience fees for each day (should be part of the rate, pays for internet, parking, etc), 15% hold for using a check card rather than a credit card (even though they pre charge you one night stay in advance once you've booked the room. They do this so you use the hold cost as a credit for their restaurants rather than spending money elsewhere on your vacation) and the room doesn't have much for tv channels. (I know, I know, you're on vacation, why need tv?  Well when it down pours all of a sudden what are you to do? Sit in the outside cabana bar?)  I'd stay here again, but I would be sure to look at the fine print. They are the number 1 hotel in ft Myers beach, but you should be #1 when compared to…

title: Great Place to stay
review: Dear moxdawg,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead. I’m pleased to hear that overall you had a pleasant experience at our resort. However, I’m sorry to hear that our daily resort fee may not have been communicated properly prior to arrival.  We appreciate your feedback, as this will assist us as we continue to make improvements at our property.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Quiet, Peaceful, Serene and nothing else needed. This hotel had it all!
review: First time visited and we liked it very much.The staff were so helpful and friendly they couldn't do enough for you.The rooms were quiet and clean.The pool area was always clean and the service there was 2nd to none. The beach area was also well maintained and clean .There was a lot of traffic in the street out front but that was no problem .They were also friendly and would let you out with no problem very laid back.We would diffidently recommend this resort to others and we would go back.Had a great time.

title: Outstanding!!
review: We just came back from visiting the Diamond Head at Ft Myers Beach. THIS is what a vacation is ALL about!!! Steps from the beach, steps from great lil restaurants and places to grab trinkets and all the FLAVOR of a vacation wrapped up in walking distance. The room had a kitchenette completely stocked, we hardly ever heard noise BUT the ocean and even in the storm of the rain, the wait staff came out and checked on our drinks while we were in the hot tub. We couldn't have asked for more but time!

title: wonderful staff,  resort tired
review: My sister & I stayed @ Diamond Head Resort for 3 nights. We were in FMB to visit dear friends & have a "mini- high school reunion". (Class of 1963 & 1964 & 1965). The room was Outstanding & the screened in patio deck with a terrific view was wonderful.  The staff treats you like family.  The first one to greet us was Bell man Derek.  He was Awesome!!!

title: Not a high end property
review: I agree with many other 2 star reviews.  This is a worn, time-share property.  Not at all high end.  For the money, there are better choices.  The availability of convenience items was zero.  No sundry store.  The ONLY non-soda vending machine located in the garage never did work. There is a spa and even a concierge and bellman in the garage but it really is an unnessary amenity to make it appear to be an upscale place.  No coffee available in the morning.  If you could find someone in the restaurant which opened at 7 a.m., a cup of coffee was $2.50.    I will say the property was clean and the people were nice enough and it was on the beach.  That is it.  I have stayed at 5 star properties, this isn't one of them.

title: What a Great Place!
review: We've stayed here several times now. What a great place. The property is in excellent shape. The people are super friendly. The pool is fantastic. I don't believe there is a bad view from any room. And the location is perfect. You can walk to everything you need from this location. I don't know how it could get any better.

title: Very Average, very tired.
review: I did extensive research prior to booking Diamond Head and I was influenced by the many positive reviews it received, however I was mildly disappointed by several factors.    The room was clean, but very worn.  The furnishings, bathroom fixtures and sliding doors were aged, with permenent areas of wear, where the finish had worn off.  Clean, but old.  The doors were difficult to slide open and lock.  The living area floor was all ceramic tile, which was practical for a property on the beach, but added to the noise factor which is prevalent throughout the building.  The building is close to the strip area of FMB, with walking access to the action, but with this there is a traffic jam in front of the building from 2 pm till 7 pm every day.  And we are talking major traffic.  The…

title: Hotel Guest first 4 nights, Premium Unit Guest last 3 nights
review: Dear Gustmammy,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead and taking the time to provide us with your detailed feedback. I’m happy to hear that you were pleased with the cleanliness of the accommodations and that you enjoyed our beachfront location. However, I’m concerned that some of our amenities did not meet your expectations and that there were technical difficulties regarding the internet. Please note that we are rated as one of the best hotels in Fort Myers Beach and this is not typical of our establishment. Perhaps the availability at the time of your stay did not allow us to place you in one of the more desirable suites, which is very unfortunate and rare. I hope you have the chance to stay with us again in the future so that we may have the opportunity to exceed your expectations and make your stay much more enjoyable. Thanks again for your feedback, as this will assist as we continue to make improvements to our property.  Sincerely, Neil Gopgood – General Manager

title: Nice Place Good Food
review: My wife and I stay at this beautiful resort hotel Jan29-Feb1, and again Feb4-6.  We had a chance to stay in both the standard hotel suite and the premium suite.  We were pleasantly surprised by all the amenities, and were treated with first class attention by the entire staff. The hotel suite was not as nice as the premium suite.  What most guests may not realize is the premium suites are "timeshare owner" suites.  The suites are all the same floor plan, and if you pay for a premium suite, you get premium accommodations.  It's that simple.  I must say its sad to read any negative review of this fine facility, as it seems those folks expect 5 star accommodations for 200 bucks per night in prime season, and didn't know the difference between a standard hotel suite and a premium…

title: Mislead
review: We tried the Travelocity "Book it and then find out where you are going" booking option to try and save a few dollars on a nice hotel.  We went for the 3.5 star and above hotel option in hopes that we would be guaranteed something nice, but we ended up at this place (Diamond Head) and it is in no way any better than at most a 2.5 star hotel.  The room we were in was in desperate need of repair and had a direct view (and smell) of the grease vents from the kitchen below.  The bathroom door was split up the side on both edges, plumbing fixtures parts were corroded or rusty - just not what you would expect from a "3.5" star hotel.  This was a real disappointment and one that we feel was due to Travelocity grossly over rating this hotel, so buyer beware if you ever use this option…

title: Disappointed
review: Dear Scott E,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead. I am sorry to hear of your experience booking through Travelocity and that some of our amenities did not meet your expectations. Please note that unfortunately, the availability was very limited at the time of your stay. The majority of our rooms certainly feature desirable views that contribute to the positive reputation DiamondHead holds. I hope you have the opportunity to visit us again in the future so you can see that this is not typical of our establishment. We will be in touch to discuss your stay further and will certainly take your feedback into consideration as we move forward and continue to make improvements to our property.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: DiamondHead Beach Resort and Spa
review: The property is older and the room we stayed in was their "hotel" section.  For the amount of money we spent for a week there i was appalled to be informed at check out i was charged an extra fee of $15 per day for resort fees...shouldn't that be included in your room rate??   With that being said...you would think this establishment could afford better furniture and a mirror in bathroom that wasn't damaged.  The bed sagged and the chair and couch were filthy.   My partner is 6'6 and he had a very difficult time showering as the shower is clearly out dated and  designed for short people.  The ice machine on our floor was out of commission and we had to go down two floors to get ice..very inconvenient.  Las but not least...the from desk was not accommodating AT all for an hour…

title: Vacation
review: Dear MiJules,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead. I am very disappointed to hear that some of our amenities were not up to par. We are rated as one of the best resorts on Fort Myers Beach and  strive to live up to that title. Unfortunately, the option for a late checkout is subject to availability and is not always able to be granted. Please know that the ice machine has been repaired. We appreciate your feedback regarding our accommodations, as this will assist us as we continue to make improvements. I hope we have the opportunity to serve you again in the future.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Winter getaway
review: The Staff at DiamondHead are fabulous!! They are so attentive to your every need and willing to provide dinner suggestions, etc. I really cannot say enough about them! From our arrival, to our departure, we were well taken care of. Hotel is right on the beach, great sweeping views with beach front dinning and bar. Drink and food service while at the pool or hot tubs. The hotel also has 2 restaurants, one more formal and the other a bar.  DiamondHead is also offering timeshare weeks in the hotel. I cannot wait to return!!

title: Couples Get-away
review: The property was clean.  Looked like a converted condo.  People were very nice, but not a high end resort.  Lunches were good.  Not the most updated resort either.  The spa area looked skimpy and underwhelming. Give it an 8 out of 10.  Still a decent place for a quick weekend retreat.  I think there are other properties on Ft Myers Beach that are a better option.

title: Great location
review: Small suites with kitchenette.  Great location, beautiful views and beach, friendly and very helpful staff.  Every suite has a phenomenal balcony!  Nice pool!  All rooms exceedingly well insulated from outside noise.

title: Very very relaxing
review: This was our first trip to Fort Myers and the Diamondhead Beach resort. We were very impressed with the level of service and courteous staff. The Chloe's restaurant had excellent food and staff. The room we had we believed was a notch above the rest and we had a great 2 days from the harsh winter of the North. Thanks!

title: Fun 3 Nights
review: We were looking for a place to stay for a few nights to visit the Fort Myers Beach area.  We hit on a great place when we found DiamondHead Beach Resort.  It provides everything you need for a fun-filled stay.  The room we stayed had a separate bedroom, nice balcony overlooking the pool and beach, a small refrigerator and microwave, which came handy.  At the pool, staff brought drinks and food during pool hours.  They also provided game activities for children and adults.  There was a beachside cafe with a great view, lots of tables and a large bar with several TV's for watching sports.  The food here was quite good...thought it would be typical bar food, but there were healthy choices and quite good.  We also tried breakfast and dinner onsite.  The food was excellent and…

title: Friendliest place on the Beach
review: We stayed three nights over New Years Eve. Hotel was by far the best on the strip. Clean and friendly staff. Property steps from sandy beach and short walk near Times Square. Two thumbs up! I recommend upgrade and get the beachfront room, the view is remarkable! Ample parking too.

title: Worth considering as somewhere to stay although pricey
review: We stayed for three nights in a one bedroom suite on the 7th floor.   We thought the rooms to be spacious and well furnished, with a good sized balcony. The view was of the beach (not 360 degrees due to the other wing of the hotel) and the pool below.  Can't really think of anything lacking in this hotel but we didn't eat there save for once on our first day, lunch at the beach side diner (nothing special).   It's a fairly ugly hotel from the beach-side. Luckily when you're on the inside or on your balcony you don't have to look at it! It reminds me of a multi-storey car park.   We had a few queries of guest relations and they were dealt with promptly and to our complete satisfaction. Staff were friendly and resourceful, and customer focused.   We tried to eat at the hotel for…

title: Great name disappointed results
review: Broken elevator, broken ice and soda machines. Noisy hallways. Old decor  Expensive drinks  If it wasn't for the great staff this place would have no personality  My wife and I visit fort myers 4 to 5 times a year and try to stay at different places. Many of the boutique hotels outshine this high priced establishment.   Keep looking for something unique. There are much better accommodations on the island

title: A Great Place to Stay
review: Dear Guest,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead. I’m sorry to hear that some of our amenities did not meet your expectations. I am glad you enjoyed the staff and that you received the customer service that we pride ourselves on here at DiamondHead. We appreciate the feedback, as this will assist us as we continue to grow and make improvements to our resort.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood – General Manager

title: Great Christmas beach vacation
review: We really enjoyed staying here.  The room was beautiful and clean, with a great view.  Loved having the kitchenette since we were traveling with children.  The staff were all great, everyone from the pool hut workers to the bellhops were helpful and friendly.  Really appreciated everything that Derek and Dave did for us during our stay!

title: Stay Here if You Want an Excellent Beach Experience
review: My family (11 of us) spent Christmas week 2014 at DiamondHead Beach Resort Hotel.  Since there were 5 families, have a suite for each family was great.  The rooms are beautiful, great views from each room.  It was especially nice to have a mini-kitchen in each room.  The staff is very welcoming and helpful.  Being right on the beach and close to the Fort Myers town square were bonuses.  We would definitely do this again.

title: Escape from the snow!
review: Diamondhead Resort is wonderful place right on Ft. Myers Beach. The best sunsets in the world are right off of your beachfront suite balcony. We stay here several times a year and are always happy with the service and facilities.

title: Best vacation ever
review: Location and staff excellent!!! Beautiful beach and great food at chloe's. And cabanas. Everything was perfect and amazing. I cant say one word bad about my experience as whole. Lovers key was breathtaking. Good times charter took me on awesome dolphin tour. The trolley was helpful and next bus app was cool to h ave on my phone to alert me of bus times.

title: 1st time to Ft. Myers Beach
review: Haven't vacationed for quite some time and staying at Diamondhead in Ft. Myers was perfect.  The property and staff were fantastic!! The property is beautiful, the weather was perfect and the staff couldn't have nicer or more helpful.  If you have stayed anyplace else on Ft. Myers Beach other than Diamondhead, you are definitely missing out.  The restaurants, Cabana's Bar and Grill and Chloe's were both great and I would definitely suggest giving them a try.  The property is in a great location and you can either take the trolley or walk to Time Square, which has many shops and places to eat.   All I can say is, I am ready to go back and will definitely stay at Diamondhead again!!

title: anniversary trip
review: We stayed for a week.  Originally, we had booked the gulf view, but when we arrived we found that our room had been upgraded for our anniversary to the beach view!  the suite was nice. there was a toaster, a small fridge and a microwave.  We had breakfast and lunch on the balcony every day.  the staff was courteous. I really liked that the balcony wrapped all the way around the unit. What was really nice was that you could easily walk down the beach to "time square" and the pier. The dolphins and pelicans were fun to watch from the pier. There were shops and restaurants in "time square"The units are being upgraded as I write this. We took the timeshare tour and got $200 dollars credit.  There is a Publix  just down the street so it was easy to get groceries.

title: Great location
review: We only stayed here one night so can't discuss about a lot that is offered at this resort. It was a great suite, well equipped kitchen, lovely living area and a great balcony with a Gulf view. Our room faced the pool and a restaurant on site - very noisy during the day and evening if you wanted to sit out on your balcony or just enjoy the Gulf breezes. No privacy, as I realized when I wanted to sit out on the balcony in the morning with a cup of coffee in my robe! You should be advised and given the option of this "resort fee" - unless you choose to use the things that are supposedly included in this fee - you shouldn't have to pay for it! We didn't use any of them! It was a nice place but not enough to want to run back here the next time we're in the area.

title: Thank God for the great weather
review: Stayed a week here on an exchange. The hotel is at the end of the tourist strip. Rooms were smaller than other time shares. Had a small fridge, a 2 burner stove and a bar sink. Rooms much smaller. Not sure if it was redone but it was very plain. We were on the pool side on the 7th floor. Noise traveled up to that area quickly. Lots of place to eat close within .75 of a mile. They are in the process of doing things over in the hotel and the beach was awesome. Chairs were 25 dollars a day to rent for 2 with an umbrella on the beach.Seemed like everything else ...yoga, kids activities, etc. was 3 to 5 bucks.They did have paddle board , jet skis and other water sport rentals right on the beach there. Talked to one guy who said he did a 90 min tour on jet skis with a guide with his…

title: Poor Communications
review: The facility is aging and has not been updated since I first stayed there 8 years ago. I needed to stay longer than check out and the front desk was unaware of the late check out opportunities. I was charged another day for me to stay 2 extra hours when it clearly states that in their handout. Great location, needs updating and front desk employees need to be better informed

title: Maybe not the most beautiful hotel but one of the nicest
review: Dear Hubert1976,  Thank you for staying with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort and Spa and for your feedback. We are truly disappointed that the many improvements we have made to the property since your last stay with us have gone overlooked. All rooms have been renovated with new furniture, carpet and flat screen TV's, along with almost half of our suites being upgraded with granite countertops, cook tops and walk-in showers. We have added a full service spa and salon as a new amenity for our guests, located just off the lobby. In 2013 our Cabanas Beach Bar was fully renovated to include a new beach serving and seating area, and our fitness room received a complete renovation.   Regarding your concern about our Late Check Out policy, whenever possible we extend a 1:00 pm checkout or 4:00 pm checkout for a nominal fee. Unfortunately, this is subject to availability as we do require enough time to ensure our arriving guests receive the same attention to detail in cleanliness as the departing guest received when they checked in.     I hope you give us an opportunity to see the improvements on a future visit and thank you again for sharing your comments.  Sincerely, Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: awesome beach side hotel
review: Un-prepossessing, an ugly giant overlooking pretty well everything else on Fort Myers Beach, but the guest experience was altogether different.   Really friendly and helpful staff (Derek and David), comfortable room with all we could wish for, plus exceptional view over the beach (white sands and an occasional dolphin playing off-shore), clean well equipped gym.  And reasonably priced.  And from there we explored – the Everglades in a day long eco-tour,  Fort Myers (Edison and Ford's holiday mansions) and the duckboard walk thru the 6 Mile Cypress Nature reserve and multiple trips to Sanibel and Captiva Island – bird watching,  kayaking though the Mangroves and great meals (Mad Hatters and Key Lime Café stand out)

title: Best service
review: My brother and his wife stayed at the Diamondhead for a few days recently.  They offered me a chance for an overnight and i did not hesitate to accept.   The staff are so friendly and accomodating, the food is excellent and they have a fun bar on beach side.  I can't say enough about the service--it's above and beyond the norm.  The pool is warm and clean with lots of seating around it.  They serve you at the pool and on the beach for your convenience.  The rooms are clean and it looked like every room had at least some view of the ocean.  I highly recommend trying out this place.

title: Family-Friendly Beach Stay
review: My husband, myself and our 5 year old daughter drove from the east coast of Florida to the west coast for a nice change of scenery (and our anniversary). We normally stay at another hotel,  which was booked,  so we picked Diamondhead based on the reviews. So happy that we gave it a shot! The rooms are slightly outdated, but clean and large. The mattress was so uncomfortable,  which was my only major issue and the reason they get a 4 out of 5.  Everything else was incredible. We had a HUGE outdoor,  screened in patio that overlooked the ocean. The couch pulled out for an extra bed. The kitchen was sufficient enough for snack foods and such. The pool was lovely and perfectly warmed. They have activities as well, perfect for a 5 year old. My daughter loved Kylie and Sharon, who…

title: Thanksgiving Vacation
review: This is a really nice hotel for a family vacation. The rooms and very clean and the staff is very kind. The location is ideal for all Fort Myers Beach restaurants and attractions. I would highly recommend it for families looking for a safe and clean environment. The only negative thing I could say was about the restaurant.  We waited for 15 minutes to get seated and nobody ever noticed that we were waiting. Other than that. All good.

title: Best Hotel in Town!!!
review: I absolutely love and miss my Diamondhead staff!!! Vicki, Marika, Jenn, Neil, Heather, Kylie, Frank, Cheri, Kathy.. etc the list goes on and on! I worked at Diamondhead for almost a year, and talk about the best people you will ever meet. If you are ever wanting a friendly, caring staff, and family environment trust me Diamondhead is the way to go. There is no place like home! I miss and love my Diamondhead family!!!! KEEP IT UP!! :)

title: Very nice hotel
review: We spent a weekend there. The check in lobby is one level up.When checking in you get nice packet with useful coupons. I asked for a high floor beach view room and got one on seventh floor.Views were amazing.(All rooms have water views but reviews I read said to ask for higher beach view room and it worth the extra).Rooms are comfortable,updated and clean. Kitchenette is equipped with all the things you need from trash bags to toaster,water kettle ,pots,and plates and cups.We ate breakfast in the room patio over looking the gulf of Mexico.Super nice.!! Hotel's pool is nice,friendly staff and nice menu poolside. The beach is super quiet and you can walk along or swim.We did para sailing(extra money) and also many attractions to rent there. The nights were little noisy with…

title: Delightful mini vacation. Great staff.
review: Dear S110, Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa on beautiful Fort Myers Beach. Nothing pleases me more than knowing we were able to give you a fantastic experience. Our goal is to always exceed your expectations and give you a memorable stay. I'm happy to hear you enjoyed Chloes and Cabanas, our two onsite restaurants. We work hard to give our guests the best dining experiences on the beach. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: Fantastic 4-Day Weekend
review: I traveled with several women from Minnesota for a Thursday-Sunday weekend getaway. Our service was incredible. Our check-in with Vicki at the front desk was smooth and she was a joy to work with, as was Derrick and others in the lower level bellhop area. The bar staff was so friendly and eager to please and even the people taking care of umbrella/chair rental were efficient and ready to help make our stay in Ft. Meyers an unforgettable experience. Even the maintenance man helped me fix my broken sunglasses and seemed happy to help me! The hotel was clean and we loved our suite. I can't say enough good things about the people who work at the Diamond Head Resort. We rented a beach umbrella and chairs every day for the full day. This has to be one of the best beaches in Ft.…

title: nothing bad to say
review: Dear Travelgirl72, Thank you so much for choosing to spend your girls weekend getaway with us. Nothing makes me happier than knowing we were able to give you a fantastic experience. Our staff truly is the best on the beach, they love to make sure everyone has a wonderful time and they strive to exceed your expectations at every opportunity. The Gulf water typically clears up around this time of year once we enter into our dryer season. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you and your friends back soon.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: What a fantastic place to stay!
review: The location of this resort is fantastic.  You can walk to everything.  Check-in and check-out was very easy.  The staff is always willing to help.  Check-out is at 11am, but for $50, you can have a late check-out of 4pm.  That way, we were able to hit the beach all morning, and still had our room to shower, pack, etc.  They do have complimentary check-out for 1pm also, which is not listed anywhere, but I found that out when I called the front desk.  Very clean, the rooms are big, the patios are great.  For real, nothing bad to say.  This resort is part of a time-share, but they will not hound you if you just say no on your first day.    You need to rent the beach chairs and umbrellas, but since I knew about this ahead of time, it really didn't bother us.  They are so…

title: Too Many Weddings not Enough Room
review: Dear jjkout, Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa on beautiful Fort Myers Beach. I'm excited to hear you had a wonderful experience and enjoyed your large one-bedroom suite. We really do strive to give you that home away from home feeling. I'm also glad you enjoyed the late check-out option. It really does allow you to enjoy more of the beach on that last day. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: Bad for people with mobility issues
review: We booked the DiamondHead Beach Resort for 4 nights. We had a tastefully decorated suite with a sea view and all the facilities you could want (fridge, dishwasher, filter coffee maker etc). The staff were great and nothing is too much trouble. On our first morning we walked down towards the beach where we were met by Kim. I initially thought that we were going to have the pushy sell on trips, activities etc. Instead Kim gave us a lot of information, maps, recommended some restaurants in the area and helped with some activities we were interested in. What a nice change to be just offered help. We took up a couple of Kim's suggestions, one of which was kayaking with a guy called Mark Hamilton Quinn. We had Dolphins around our kayaks and Mark pointed out all the wildlife as we…

title: Diamondhead Hotel
review: The second weekend of October, we spent 4 days at the Diamondhead Hotel.  Upon arriving we were greeted and given instructions and direction for check in, the process was quick and we were in our room in no time.  The room was clean and views were stunning, overlooking the pool and ocean. The staff was very friendly and helpful, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel in the future.

title: Great view, great room.  Nice property.
review: Dear 12Champlin, Thank you very much for spending four days with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort on beautiful Fort Myers Beach. I'm excited to hear that our Bellmen and Front Desk team did a great job of getting you checked-in and settled into your vacation quickly. Our Gulf views truly are stunning and I'm glad you enjoyed them. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you back soon.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: beautiful property,outstanding customer service
review: My husband and our two children (ages 13 & 10) just spent 6 nights at DiamondHead and had a wonderful stay.  We were on the top floor with a beautiful view of the Gulf and the town of Ft. Myers Beach.  Pros: Kitchenette 1 bedroom suite with plenty of room Terrific balcony with 2 lounge chairs and table with 4 chairs. Large, clean bathroom Cabanas restaurant on the beach Water sports- we took out the ocean trike, jet skied & my son fished off the beach and off the pier half a mile away. Lounge chairs & umbrellas for rent on the beach. Plenty of pool towels available Nice pool area with cocktail waitress All staff was very friendly & helpful  Could walk to restaurants and shops  Cons: Dark hallways Common areas around elevator on main floor could have been cleaner Toaster and a…

title: So happy that I stayed here!!
review: Dear ncbiscuit, Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa. I'm extremely pleased to hear that you and your family had a wonderful experience. There's nothing like waking up in the morning and gazing out at the calm Gulf of Mexico, especially from the top floor which you were on. I also appreciate the feedback on the improvements we can make as well. We are always striving to give our guests the best experience possible. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: Good location but hotel Noisy at night
review: we've been going to Diamondhead for over 8 years. Excellent location, gorgeous beach, a full service hotel. Fantastic staff friendly and eager to assist . everything you need for a great vacation is right here. we love it and are already planning next year's trip!

title: Nice accommodations and location however . . .
review: We stayed two nights here.  Originally booked a gulf view suite but upgraded to beach view which was facing straight on to beach from a large balcony - very nice. Cost to upgrade for two nights was $60 which we were told was half price.  Bed was comfortable and had ocean view.  The room was clean and fairly spacious with a decent kitchenette.  There is a resort fee and the only thing it covers that is not standard in any other hotel is the use of bikes.  It says "rental of beach chairs and umbrella" which cost $30 a day - not sure why they charge for the "privilege" of paying again.    The room came with a buy on/get one (BOGO) drink coupon and a few other discount coupons.  They allow people to smoke cigars at the beach bar/restaurant so we decided to eat elsewhere to avoid the…

title: Amazing place to stay!
review: Dear Travlbug39, Thank you very much for choosing to stay with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa. I'm pleased to hear you enjoyed your beach-view suite. The resort fee covers many things that we feel most hotels don't offer, things like parking, towel service, WiFi, local and toll-free calls, daily newspaper, fitness center, daily in-room coffee and tea, and the guest bicycles. We strive to exceed our guests expectations at every opportunity and giving you a special experience is our top priority. Thank you again for staying with us and we do hope to see you back in the future.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: Great Beach Location
review: We had an amazing time!  Everybody was extremely helpful and willing to go above and beyond to make our experience that much more enjoyable.  The room was very clean and absolutely beautiful with an amazing view.  We will definitely be going back to stay there in the future!

title: A beautiful wonderful resort!
review: Dear Chris O, Thank you so much for choosing to stay with us at DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa on Fort Myers Beach. I'm pleased to hear that our staff took great care of you and made your experience one to remember. Our goal is to exceed your expectations at every opportunity. Thank you again and we are looking forward to seeing you back soon.  Sincerely,  Neil Hopgood - General Manager

title: *******CONFY BEDS*******
review: 3rd time in 4 years my wife and I have stayed at this resort. It is a condo style hotel with very nice updated 1 bedroom suites. The proximity to the beach is one of the best on either Florida coasts.  You walk out of the hotel and on to the beach. Rooms are nicely decorated and include small refrigerator and microwave so not suitable if you want to cook meals. Perfect for us as we eat out at the many great restaurants in the area. This hotel has a restaurant "Chloe's" that we have used for breakfast only with adequate results. While the food is just OK the ocean/beach views are great. My wife and I are either golfing or on the beach, so we have never taken advantage of the other hotel amenities, but the pool and hot tub area looks first class. Furnishings in room are…

title: Pool & Cabana Bar Closed the week we were there. Definitely not resort atmosphere
review: We planned our trip in March 2014 and stayed Sept. 6-13, 201 in Room 809. One week prior to arriving we were told the pool & cabana bar would be closed for maintenance and repairs.
