They have added a little entertainment around the pool area and this is a welcome change.  Everyone was helpful, and friendly.  The general area of FMB is  going down a little bit.   The beach is clean but many restaurants have closed on this strip since my last visit.  It does look like they are trying to revive.  It is  still a nice area to unwind, and relax amongst friends.  Go relax, and have a BLAST

title: Great Resort would come back
review: Stayed here with My wife and a one year old. The rooms were better then we expected, clean and had all the necessities. Crib and high chair were provided (no fee). There is also free parking and no resort fee (unlike some other places). The room had a fridge, microwave and a cooking top which was very handy. Especially with a baby. The rooms were made up everyday.  The beach is handy, we bought our own chairs and an umbrella across the road and used that. Saw a small stingray swim past, a pair of dolphins and fish jumping from the beach. There is an outfit that offers para sailing, jet skis, tours etc but we didn't partake in any.  Hotel is nicely located close to a Grocery store (Tops and Publix) and the pier and restaurants are a short walk away. For those inclined a Hooters…

title: great anniversary stay
review: Wife and I stayed here for 4 nights for our 10 year anniversry.  It was our first trip taken without our infant, so we were looking to relax and enjoy some adults only time with each other.  We originally booked to stay at Pink Shell, but we cancelled at the last minute do the beach work being done there.  We had an oceanfront room on the 3rd floor.  We originally were on the top floor (12th), but wife said "its wayyyy too high".  The hotel was more than happy to switch us to a lower floor and we were in a room on the 3rd floor within 30 minutes.  Great service by the front desk!  We are not the adventurous type, so we didn't do much in terms of tours.  Just hung out by the beach and pool, with lots of eating and drinking in between. Pool: very nice and a welcome retreat from…

title: Mediocre Accommodations But Did the Job
review: This hotel is in a good location: it's walking distance to a number of restaurants and the "downtown" shopping area, if you can call it that.  It is located right on the beach, and has a nice swimming pool.  Another plus is that it is very quiet after sundown, whereas the Lani Kai down the block was loud and had bands playing late at night.  Room was sizable and had a kitchenette with a refrigerator and microwave as well as dishes, which came in handy.  Air Conditioner worked well, and had a balcony that was screened in that overlooked the beach.  The room was nice and big, and had a pull out couch.  The bedroom was separate from a living area, also a nice touch.    My complaints are as follows.  The bed was not comfortable.  The linens were SO cheap and scratchy against my skin…

title: Very nice   Terrific.
review: I initially went to pier view hotel   I went up to the room took one look in without even going in and went back to lobby to get my money back. Diamond head was my savior. While it was twice as much it was literally a hundred times nicer. Staff are great. Rooms are spacious and very clean. The view of the beach spectacular and the room has a beautiful and large terrace. It's just great. Don't hesitate to stay here it is terrific. Do not go to pier view. It is a dump.

title: Nothing special
review: This  place has a great location and is clean, but that's about it. The rooms are spacious enough but cheaply built.  The furniture is hard and worn. The bed was clean but not all that comfortable. It needed new pillows for sure. The bathroom fan rattled loudly. One of the lights didn't work. The towels were scratchy. The need fabric softener.  The place is adequate if you can get good pricing but just don't expect a spa environment  like the name implies.

title: This was our sixth visit, and the best yet
review: We love the Gulf Coast and the Diamondhead Resort, this is our sixth visit and the best to date.  Lovely large suites, with a large screened balcony, ask for an oceanfront room if possible, but all the rooms offer a partial ocean view.  It is great being able to step out of the hotel and straight on to the beach, which is clean with a variety of watersports available if you wish.  All the staff friendly and helpful, lovely maids, especially the one who admired our son's long curly red hair.  Lots of malls, cinema's and attractions within easy driving distance make Fort Myers Beach an ideal location to stay.  Thanks to the Diamondhead and their staff for making our 14 day holiday a success.

title: A great find
review: We just came back from Diamondhead, and I must say it was a wonderful place. My family including a 15 year old daughter had a great time.  The rooms were done tastefully, nice size, loved the screened in balcony, kitchenette was nice to have. We went to Tops grocery store and got bagels, milk, cereal, and some yogurt and we were set for breakfast and got footlong hoagies at Subway for lunch, so we had lunch for 2 days. These are all within walking distance, so we saved monies by just eating out at dinner. Every dining establishment we went to was very good. Tried italian restaurant across the street and it was excellent and then Times Square restaurants- Yukatan, Nervous Nellie's and Sob, all very good.  Activities at Diamondhead were parasailing, waverunners, banana boats.…

title: Wonderful Resort
review: We spent a week at the DiamondHead Beach Resort, the resort was beautiful. Hotel staff was wonderful. The suites were very spacious and the beachfront room was great. The hotel is right on the beach and only a short walk to town. Everything you need is right in the hotel.

title: Nice for a group
review: We stayed here with a group of friends all with kids. Had a great time large pool 2 hot tubs. Ocean very close to everything. Elevators are painfully slow and hot. Nickel and dime you for kids activties most hotels we have stayed at offer these for free or very little cost. Could use an update through out.  Would stay here again but on a lower floor to avoid the use of the elevator. Rooms are clean and well done. Beach chairs and umbrellas can be rented a little pricey as well.

title: Best place on SW Florida Beach
review: This is THE BEST place to stay on SW Florida, hotel view is perfect, very laid back ambiance, the place is unique, we been going there for the last 6 years, and we can't wait to go back soon.

title: Why is this place not at the TOP of the list ?????????
review: My wife and I just spent 5 days at the DiamondHead Beach Resort and could not have been happier.  I do not understand why this property is not rated much higher than its current position.  I have trusted Tripadvisor for many years and will not travel without first researching on this site.  There seemed to be nothing but positive reactions regarding the Diamondhead, and it did not disappoint.   From the time we made reservations to the time we checked out, each and every individual associated with this establishment was pleasant, courteous, and eager to assist in any way possible.  We requested a high floor, and did receive a top (12th)  floor unit that faced southwest along the beach.  It seems that  every unit has some view of the beach and all have a nice large screened patio…

title: Beautiful view of the gulf
review: One of the nicest places to stay with beautiful views of the gulf.  Chloes restaurant was a great place to eat.

title: We loved it, may be back but not the same room
review: Don't get rooms 211, 311 and 411, the rooms themselves are lovely and have everything you need for a comfortable vacation but despite the size of the  balconies, which are large, we wouldn't stay in one of them again.  they over look the beach and have a great view of the sunset but the roof to the restaurant is right there and the noise from the turbines and air conditioner is very loud, hard to hold a conversation loud.

title: Great experience
review: My girlfriend and I took a trip to Fort Myers Beach. We had heard of the Lani Kai before but when we looked into it everyone said it was a dump. After some searching we found Diamondhead and decided that it seemed like a nice place and that we would try it out. We couldn't have asked for a better experience. The staff was friendly, the accommodations were lovely and the location was perfect. We will definitely be coming back.

title: What a G-R-E-A-T place!!!!
review: This was our first time to this part of Florida (we usually go to the East Coast but we cautiously decided to try something different this year).  A friend recommended DiamondHead as they swear it's the best place on Ft. Myers Beach!  They weren't wrong - all the "rooms" are SUITES, with a separate bedroom, and a pull-out sofa in the living Room.  The views from our Suite were amazing - it seemed to us that ALL the rooms there have fantastic views of the Gulf of Mexico.  Our Suite also had a HUGE Lanai, where we would sit out at night, have a glass of wine as we listened to the waves lapping on the shore..  We found that tho there is plenty to do in the area, you don't really need to leave, DiamondHead at all if you don't want to - they have everything there that we wanted, a…

title: Great Hotel!!
review: We had a wonderful time and experience.  The check in and out service was smooth sailing with a wonderful staff.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The upgraded pool view room was great could not have asked for a better view.   I do wish they had an adult pool and the pool side bar was a little slow moving but once you got your drink it was amazingly good.   It was within walking distance to the little shops and restaurants which is good because traffic gets backed up fast.  The activities they offer are great and pricing is really good too.  We drove around to compare this hotel with all of the others and we were very pleased with the location and the appearance of this one compared to all of the others.  Great service, location and rooms.  Thank you!

title: GREAT!
review: Huuuge Rooms, Great Location , Free-WIFI, Free Parking , No Resort Fee, Small pool (but who care when the beach is 10meter ahead..  i think gulf-view at to most of the rooms... Im from sweden and really loved the place..

title: Great location, huges rooms!!!
review: We booked this for a relaxing few days after 10 days in Orlando. we thought we would get a standard hotel room but how wrong we were, the rooms are huge, two bedrooms, kitchen lounge and massive balcony. The only slight downside was that the swimming pool was a little small but you on right on the beach so no problem. Short walk to lots of restaurants etc, great definitely would recommend.

title: very nice stay
review: the Hotel was very nice, people were nice and the rooms are very nice and clean.  A few things that was a downer were, the beach chairs and umberlla closed at 5 and the bar by the pool closed early to. The hallways are very dark and the noise you can hear everything in the hallways.  When someone closes their door the whole floor hears it.  It sounds like a gun shot.  It seem the whole area closed early.  We went to the Time square around 9pm and the resturant we ate at said they close at 10 and we had an hour to eat.   The 2 resturants I would recommend is Beach pierside Grill, very good food and the server Alex was very nice.  I would recommend to sit in his section.  The other resturant is Bayfront Bistro, very nice, alittle price, need to dress up to go there.  Its right on…

title: Excellent loction, people & amenitites!"
review: I had the pleasure of staying at the DiamondHead Resort in the beginning of June. From the moment I arrived all the employees were helpful, accessible, and friendly.  Our room was incredibly spacious yet cozy, clean, and with a total laid-back beachy vibe.  We adored our beachfront view and were totally surprised to have a screened-in balcony! The food and drinks inside and out were delicious and reasonably priced.  The in-room, touch-screen computers provided seamless technological accessibility without searching for a business center or hooking up wi-fi.  I would absolutely have no doubt about staying here again.

title: great location, good customer service
review: We went for a long walk on the beach and had a nice dinner right at the hotel, and breakfast the next morning. We also walked down a few   blocks to the Gulfshore Grill and Cottage  that has great food and  great views, and walked home along the beach.  This walk would be a little far if you are not used to walking.  We had a non-smoking room but someone must have been smoking on the balcony and the room smelled like it but when we asked they came up right away and freshened up the room for us. It was very clean and we will be staying there again in June.

title: Perfect for a family vacation
review: Dear LauraS46,  Thank you so much for your review of DiamondHead! We are so glad to hear that you enjoyed your stay and even more thrilled that you will be back in June.  It was also great to hear that you brought your concern to the front desk and that they were able to help remedy the situation to your satisfaction.  See you again soon!  The DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa Management Team

title: Absolutely loved it
review: I stayed here for 4 days with my 2 kids (ages 7 and 10) and we loved it! The hotel is right on the beach. The rooms are clean and all have kitchenettes. The pool is nice and the staff is so friendly. I also liked that they had activities for the kids each day. The restaurant at the hotel is also great- and I love that you can eat by the pool with your famlily. All in all, a great stay.

title: Really?
review: Dear aslstlouis,  Thank you so much for your review of the Resort.  It is great to hear when we have reached our guests expectations and that they have enjoyed their stay with us!    We hope to see you again in the near future! Sincerely, The DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa Management Team

title: Great for family travel...even with food allergies!
review: We had a premium suite, as it has a stovetop which we need due to daughter's allergies.  Clean suite, nicely set up.  Had all necessary kitchen utilities, pots etc.  Grocery store within 10 minutes' walk.  Beautfiul beach, close access to water, unlike many of the more southern hotels.  Pool was great for young child as well.  Overall, beach was kept well grromed, no garbage, as were the pool facilities.  If we needed anything in the room (more dishwasher detergent, more coffee or to replace a lightbulb), service was provided swiftly and efficiently.  Walking distance (15-20 minutes) to Times Square, restaurants, tourist shopping etc.  Only negative was the meal we had at the main restaurant...as it is called a seafood restaurant, that was what we ordered.   Very poor quality…

title: Everything we expected and much more!!
review: My husband and I stayed at The Diamond Head  Resort in April and the weather was fantastic.  This was our first trip to Fort Myers and we were pleasantly surprised at the beauty of Fort Myers Beach and the outstanding service we received at The DiamondHead Resort. From the moment we arrived and David greeted us till  the day we left (reluctantly)  our stay was relaxing and top notch.  The location is great, rooms are clean and views are spectacular!  We  highly recommend a trip to the Diamond Head! We hope to make a return trip soon!!

title: best hotel ever...they are a chain of hotel (sunstream hotels) and they are all wonderful! however diamonhead is awesome
review: all the rooms in diamonhead are suites. they have a seperate room for the bedroom and then they have a living room area that has a sofa which conveniently opens up to a sofa bed. also they have a small kitchen area with approximately 2-4 chairs in the dinning table. it is right on the beach. it is super slow paced. and there is an older crowd there. i love this hotel . i try to go like three times a year. there is also a pier that u can walk to...if u want a beutiful peaceful vacation ...then this is the place!!

title: Amazing experience, everyone should go!!!
review: We came to the resort at the last second, and were able to get one of the suites! All of the staff was amazing helpful and kind!!! Our room was phenomonal, it was quit at night, and we had an awesome view of the shore!! I can not wait to visit again!!!

title: Great for a girls week or family fun.
review: It's my goto place for lots of fun! Service, hotel, pool and bar are great! Wonderful location on the beach and walking distance to restaurants and clubs.Have had many a family birthday celebration and girls week at this hotel. Staff is great and have never had a bad experience. We even celebrated a family 65th bitrhday after a hurricane blew through and the staff and hotel took really great care of all 24 of us!

title: Family Friendly with something for the entire family and perfectly located on Esterro Island.  Total thumbs up.
review: We had a great time at Diamond Head Beach Resort and Spa!  We traveled with 3 other families, all of us with children ranging in age from 10-5 and there was something for everyone!  The pool and cabana bar is perfectly situated next to the ocean, with its HUGE, flour-soft beach and lots of beach activities to participate in or just relax in a chaise lounge under an umbrella.  Joanna the childrens actitivies director is awesome!  From an easter egg hunt on the beach, complete with the easter bunny, to hermit crab races and poolside bingo for prizes, she makes it fun for everyone. A ten minute stroll down the beach will get you to the Ft. Myers Pier to fish or watch the dolphons swim and Times Square shopping area with lots of fun food and beverage joints along the way...we highly…

title: Great beach and nice hotel
review: Dear Amy_Eagan,  Thank you so much for your positive review!  We love hearing about our guests experiences and are so happy that you decided to share this with other travelers.  It sounds like you and your family and freinds had an amazing time and we look forward to seeing you again in the very near future!  Sincerely, The DiamondHead Beach Resort & Spa Management Team

title: Diamondhead is the best on Fort Myers Beach!!
review: What a fantastic beach.  Warm water, dolphins, stingrays, lots to do and see.  We had a great time, will go again sometime and for sure stay here as this is the nicest hotel with the best beach right out front.

title: Wonderful resort, very comfortable with incredible views!!!
review: Absolutely Love Diamondhead!  First the weather was awesome this weekend!!  We came a day early because of weather issues in our state and they were fantastic in getting us a room and upgraded us for free!!  The room was great, clean and updated.  We did not spend much time in it as we were there for the weather, beach and pool!!!  The pool was clean and the bar service was great!!  Very friendly!  Access to the beach was important to us and it was right there!!  Beautiful!  Lots of activities and other restaraunts within walking distance.  We did not rent a car, because everything we needed was within walking distance!  We rented mopeds(across the street) and loved riding around to look at the scenery!!  We had a great time and hope to make it an annual trip or more, if we…

title: Horrible customer service
review: Truly enjoyed our stay at the Diamond Head resort.  We had an ocean facing suite on the 11th floor.  The suite was large, plenty of room to move around also had a large screened in balcony with lounge chairs and table and chairs.  Room was very clean,only complaint would be that housekeeping didn't come around until mid to late afternoon on most days.  The employees were all very friendly and I felt they were there to make you as comfortable as possible.  It is also a time share resort and they were a little pushy to get you to sign up for a tour.  We ended up killing an hour one day to do the tour just to get the 150.00 credit they give you off your bill.  I would stay there again if ever in Fort Myers area.  Other reviews I had read did not recommend eating at the restaurant,…

title: We loved our stay. Great view!
review: We had a great time here with a very nice view of the Gulf.  I was able to really relax.   The people were friendly and they were able to tell us were to go and what to do, the restaurant wasn't good and it was expensive.  The weather was perfect.

title: Best Resort On the beach!!
review: We just returned from a wonderful stay at The Diamond Head Resort. The suite was very nice....super clean and beautifully decorated. We stayed on  the 10th floor overlooking the pool and the beach. The first night we arrived, we enjoyed dinner in the restaurant. The food was fabulous. We had the prime Rib dinner and Key lime pie for dessert.  We decided to try room service for the next morning and were pleasantly surprised. Having breakfast on the screened-in balcony overlooking the beach was fantastic!! The entire staff of the resort should be commended on there fabulous customer service skills.....above and beyond!!

title: Will never stay at this resort
review: I had reservations to stay a weekend but never made it due to a medical problem that prevented me from traveling.  I don't recall being told that their cancellation policy is 72 hours when I made the reservation, but they were sure to remind me about it when I called to cancel the reservation 54 hours before I was due to check in.  After bouncing me around to four different people I ended up speaking with a snotty women who claimed to be the "supervisor."  I was told there was nothing they could do and I would not receive a refund of my $305 deposit.  For all I know this may be the nicest place in Fort Myers Beach but as I see it they stole my money and they will never see me or anyone I know step foot in their resort.

title: Nice Hotel in a good location on a great beach
review: The hotel was very nice.  We enjoyed dining outdoors for dinner as well as lunch.  The hotel is right on the beach and a 10 minute walk to the "times square" area of shops.  Had an opportunity to have my hair cut in the hotel salon and was very satisfied.  The rooms are spacious suits and have great views of the gulf and a large screened in lanai.  The staff was friendly and helpful.  I would stay here again.

title: The best on the beach !!!!
review: What a great place ! The staff is super friendly and the suites are very clean. All the suites have thier own private balconys. We were fortunate enough to have a gulf view room. I never shut those doors one time. There's nothing like hearing the surf aas you fall asleep. When we go back to Fort Myeres Beach this is the only place i'll be staying at. It is a little pricey but you do get whet you pay for !

title: Very nice
review: Our stay at Diamond Head was great. The view is awesome the rooms were great although we did hear the chairs on the floor above us at times but we didn't stay in the room very much we were either on the beach or walking and taking in the views. The staff members were great. Dave (bell man) was especialy great he helped us with our fishing trip and guide which turned out to be great with captian Bob. We also went to the Everglades with Jody, Bob's wife, we had a great time. Everything you want is with in walking distance for us anyway.  We do have a few cons although;  We booked our trip in Nov of 2010 paid in full. An oversight on our part our departure flight didn't leave until 8:50 pm, we asked 3 differant times about the 4 pm checkout time we were very williing to pay the…

title: We LOVE Diamondhead!
review: Diamondhead is an awesome resort directly on the beach. We love the fact that the swimming pool and the hot tubs are also directly on the beachfront, so you can swim and still enjoy the ocean. The hotel is very nicely kept and the food at Cabanas is great! We ate by the pool everyday! We used the beach services of John and his crew for our beach chairs and umbrells which were setup for us daily ($20/day). We also went parsailing and the kids rented the beach cycles. All the suites have an ocean view and our very spacious. We will definitely return! :)

title: Diamondhead-Worth the visit
review: I must admit, I am a stalker here on Tripadvisor but felt I needed to rate this trip.  Overall I would rate Diamondhead a very good resort.  The term luxury should be eliminated from thier description but compared to what is surrounding them, it pretty much is.  Only stayed 2 days but I must give shout outs to Mike the Bellman, and the pool staff.  Very friendly and accomodating.  I had room service and it was very friendly and quick.  Not sure what the other reviewers are complaning about.  It was just fine.  Just level your expectations.  Anyway, the proximity to the beach is amazing.  The beach is great with lots to do and the pool area is really good too.  I had a couple drinks at the bar.  It wasn't bad but had to try and get the bartender's attention a couple times while…

title: Wonderful facility
review: This was our first stay at the resort and had a wonderful time.  The condo that we stayed in was beautiful with granite countertops, big king size bed and for the kinds 2 flat screen tvs.  We had a nice view of the gulf and pool area and the outside deck was good size.  The resort is quiet so no late night yelling sessions.  The pool is big and was kept warm for swimming.  The location was perfect for going into the town or walking the beaches.  From the time we got there the staff was pleasant and helpful with anything that we needed.  I would stay again in a heartbeat.  Thank you to DiamondHead for making our stay in Fort Myers so much fun and very comfortable.

title: Nice for the area.
review: Nicest hotel on the beach, but this is not West Palm or Naples. Great location, walk to everything. Dinning is not very good in the area. The hotel restaurant (Choles) is a disaster. Clean nice rooms. My wife said the Spa was not up to her expectations, but I'm not either (ha).  Overall not a bad place to get away explore and get some sun.  Pool is nice and the Gulf is steps away.

title: Pretty Good
review: Very friendly staff. room service sucks! I asked for coffee 2 times then finally gave up and went and got it myself. Other than that, it's a nice place.

title: Fine if your expections are set properly
review: According to Frommer's Florida 2010, Diamondhead is a luxury resort on Fort Myers Beach.  When I think "luxury", I think the Bellagio in Vegas or the Delano in South Beach.  So "luxurious" and Diamondhead didn't quite go together for me.  Sure--it is a decent hotel with basic amenities (sleeper sofa, fridge, microwave, dishwasher, etc.) but it is a bit tired looking (i.e. broken tile in the bathroom, appliances a bit of rust, cracking caulk, etc.).  We stayed for $99/night in the off-season and I wouldn't have paid more than that--it was a reasonable place if your expectations are set accordingly.  I cannot comment on the timeshare side, since I believe that in room 606, we were in the regular hotel part.  Pros: Heated pool, on the beach, close to town, screened-in balcony,…

title: Had a Blast
review: Great location close to everything awsome beach looks great love that they keep it clean The hotel staff was very helpfull and informative want to thank Dave the bellmen and Vicki the front desk Lady thanks for the info The beach staff all great Mark thanks for talking us into a tour and thanks to our tour guide Matt for the education and memories our children will remember always look forward to a return trip next year

title: great vacation spot
review: Had a wonderfull time at the resort perfect location close to all the resturants and what a view. The hotel staff was excellent Vicki at the front desk, think his name was Dave the bell man very helpfull. The guys on the beach were awsome John and Mark both very friendly and helpfull as well we did the waverunner tour with Matt and he was great also saw loads of dolphin and a couple of manatees came right up to us while we were floating we highly reccomend the waverunner tour with holidaywatersports thanks to all and we will see you next year hopefully!!

title: Very Disappointed
review: My husband and I own a timeshare on Fort Myers Beach already that we go to every year, however last year we went to a timeshare presentation at Diamondhead.  At the time we weren't sure we wanted to pay the $$ they were asking so they gave us a deal that we could stay in the unit for our stay this year at a discounted rate and then decide.    Boy were we disappointed!  First of all we had a payment plan put in place for the week that we sent in payment each month.  Good thing I keep track of the payments for when it got close to our trip when i called to verify it was paid in full, i was told half the payments had never been received!!  After going back and forth with the owner it was finally straightened out and we were assured we were all set.    We got to the hotel and…

title: awesome
review: I think it was the best resort on the beach.  The other ones we passes while walking were just a little dumpy.  We went on a all adult pirate cruise, with free pirate punch, awesome...the smoking oyster bar has great food and drinks.  There was just so much night life going on, and a great beach during the day

title: amazing view
review: We stay at the Diamondhead in October. WOW! what a great place. Fort myers is beautiful in itself but we wished we had stayed here longer as it was great. Staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms was to die for. It was a one bedroom apartment with small kitchen area and lounge. We had a balcony which looked over the beach and the Gulf. the patio doors gave great viewing both from the bedroom and the sitting area and we had breakfast everymornong looking out over the ocean. The pool was nice abd relaxing with a nice bar beside it. Great place to stay

title: Girlfriend Getaway!
review: Just returned from 4 - nights at DiamondHead Beach Resort.  The staff at the resort is wonderful!  Great 1 BR accomodations with sofa bed & a nice kitchen.  We chose a beach/pool view room & enjoyed the large screened balcony with table & 4 - chairs, plus 2 - lounge chairs.  The pool was warm, the beach was great, we rented beach umbrella & chairs.  There were stingrays in the water during our visit.  This resort is within walking distance of many restaurants.  Great getaway!

title: SLICE OF PARADISE
review: Good hotel. Rooms nice size, clean, tile floor in main room, huge private almost 180degree screened balcony with excelent views(we stayed in room #811. From eight floor we could watch sunset over the ocean and long white strech of beach or if we turn heads the other way, city lights.). Nice size bathroom. Nice pool area (5' DEEP) with two hot tubs and poolside bar.  Central air cond. system all thru hotel, that means pretty sound sleep. Friendly staff. We would stay at this hotel again, everything we needed for confiort and satisfaction was provided to us. Also romantic place. If you like cuban food, I suggest two places.  For takeout (best cuban sandwich and also very good mexican food) go to "TACO MIX" 11 years in business,BONITA SPRINGS, 20 Min. from this hotel south on left…

title: Amazing Trip, Will Return!!
review: My husband and I wanted to get away for the weekend for a staycation (from Clearwater) , heard about the hotel from friends who have stayed on the beach before. When we arrived, there was alot of parking, a bellman already outside helping us with our luggage and was very informative of the restaurants and fun things to do in the area. The check in process was very quick and the ladies were very nice. We had a top floor view of the ocean with a very large balcony that we sat on while eating our breakfast. It was plenty of space for the two of us. One day, we went on the jetskies and laid by the pool and had a really good time. Our last night, we ate at the restaurant and enjoyed a really nice meal, and got a complimentary glass of wine coupon. On checkout day, we were sad to go…

title: Terrible customer service!
review: I Had reservations for the weekend for my sons football game, my daughter had an unexpected softball tournament at the same time in West Palm. I asked to change my reservation to one day to try to accomodate both of my kids games and I was told I would have to still pay for the other night. Since the hotel had already charged me for one night, I asked if they can give me a credit so I can spend another weekend in the future, no luck! Not to mention they had told me I had three days prior to cancel my reservation, when I called they told me I had missed the cut off by :45 minutes. I guess they rather take my $129 than have a customer.

title: The Best Hotel for a vacation in Fort myers
review: the hotel is beachfront so is very convenient. Plenty of parking space. The suites are large and the balcony is huge. we had partial city view and partial oceanfront. In the morning it was so nice to sit in the huge balcony with our breakfast. The staff was friendly and very nice. The first room that we got we did not like the view and they inmediately send someone to help us to move the suitcase to the new room that had a wonderful view. The last they we had to check out at 12:00 but we wanted to stay in the beach a little longer. we asked if we could leave the car in the parking and they said "yes". Wonderful place!!!

title: wonderful stay
review: My wife and I went to Diamondhead Fort Myers beach for the 1st time Aug 17 to 22, 2010.  we had a great time.   It is just down from the pier and there are many restaurants close by.  We drove to Sanibel island  (about 10 min drive).   The sunsets from the Hotel were incredible.   We also took the 2 hr dolphin tour on jet skis and had dolphins swim within a few feet of our jet ski.    The hotel itself was very clean and more than enough room  (1 bedroom suite) for us.  The staff were very helpful and responsive to all our needs. The restaurants on property had specials each day.  "Anthony's on the gulf" was a wonderful Italian restaurant right on the beach just a short distance down from the hotel

title: wonderful stay at a great price
review: went for a birthday getaway with friends. Had a terrific time!  Hotel was clean, rooms and pool area clean. We enjoyed the short walk to Times Square area. Plenty of places to eat within walking distance. Cabana's was good for lunch and we enjoyed Chloe's lounge and food, also.  Did the time share tour, received $100 credit for our time, no hassles.  I have read reviews about shady part of town, dog owners on beach (so what - lucky for them - never unleashed and never saw dog dirt anywhere walking.)  We would come back!

title: Beachfront location.
review: Stayed here for 2 nights and had a top floor, south facing apartment. The apartment itself was pretty good - separate bedroom and bathroom and a living room/kitchenette. Large screened balcony with great views across the beach and Gulf of Mexico, although the screen did make your eyes go a bit funny! One danger though - the sliding door, while stickered to make you aware when it's shut has a fairly high step when going from the balcony in. I badly stubbed my toe entering the room and, 3 months later, still have a black and damaged nail. When the reception were informed they gave some fake concern but didn't seem inclined to record the incident. The hotel externally looks like a cross between a prison and a multi-storey car park - I can see why our brochure only had a picture of…

title: Must go
review: I visited Fort Myers couple of days ago and before going there I did my research for about 2 months on the best beaches and best hotels in florida, since I live near by miami I wanted to go a far off place. I wanted to make it special since it was my husband's birthday and I am just in love with this place. We booked pool beach view room and then when I called up to the hotel and requested for beach front room they gave upgraded that room for complementary which was awesome. The location of the hotel is perfect, they had direct access to beach. The balcony is too good. All the balconies are screened for privacy and they have big balconies with patio and beach chair. This was an awesome place. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Everything We Were Looking For and More!
review: We were looking for a relaxing and fun time on the beach and found it at the Diamondhead.  When we arrived our luggage was loaded from our car by the friendly bellman and we found it again in our room, a nice perk and the start to being well taken care of.  The room was spacious, clean and the balcony had a spectacular view of the beach.  My husband and I had the bedroom and our 2 teens had the living room and we were definately not tripping over each other, there was plenty of room.  The kitchen area was perfect size as we always like to have breakfast and lunch food available and then we easily walked to local restaurants for dinner.  The beach was beautiful and we took full advantage of the chairs and umbrellas and the water sports available.  The pool and hot tub area was…

title: Staff was nice and friendly.  We has a...
review: Staff was nice and friendly.  We has a great view facing the pool and beach.  Loved the spacious screened in patio.  Lots if room in our suite.  Pool and hot tub were nice and plenty of places in the sun.  All the places in the shade we empty, but towels were holding the spots in the shade.  Cloe's restaurant was not good.  Service was nice, but food was not.  We got the beef sandwich and it was so salty we could not eat it.  The waitress did take it off the bill, but we would up going to public for their sandwiches (we also did this the next day for lunch).    We did the timeshare promo and it was low pressure, which made us happy.  We got $100 to spend at the resort.  We used it for the overpriced beach chairs and a massage.  Drinks at the pool were watered down and you could…

title: great hotel
review: had a week here after our week in orlando, fantastic hotel with the most amazing views, great service great pool area and wonderful beach, no complaints at all.

title: Every nice person in the world works there!!
review: This resort is amazing. The views are incredible. Fun for the whole family. Rent jet ski's or sit by the pool. Cocktails are fun and served poolside. Yum! The restaurant has a nice menu and light fare by the pool. Definatly woth it.

title: Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!
review: We booked this hotel as we were taking our 6 month old daughter on holiday with us and wanted somewhere with a kitchen.  The exterior of the hotel looks ugly and as we were being taken to our room and walking along the outside corridor I was thinking we had made a huge mistake booking this hotel.  I was proved wrong as the hotel is great.  The service was first class.  Every member of staff made us feel welcome (especially the pool waitress who gave our daughter lots of attention) and they were very friendly.  We ate in the hotel restaurant on our first night.  It was expensive but very good quality.  There is an Italian restaurant across the road which was just exceptional.  There was a good restaurant about a mile away called Charlies which has a massive salad bar.  We did not…

title: Needs to be renovated
review: Staff was very pleasant but hotel is in need of updating.  Balcony is great, very large.  Can't believe this is considered a 3 star hotel.  Seem to be spending all their money on the time shares and leaving the rental portion of hotel go.  Service in restaurant is very slow.  If you want a beach chair you have to pay for it, rate you pay at this hotel it should be free.

title: Diamondhead Beach Resort Truly Met Our Expectations!
review: We took a family vacation April 4 -9, 2010 (Easter/Spring Break).  Upon arrival we were greeted by the hotel staff/valet who took our luggage and parked our car for us.  We then checked in which was very quick and easy, very friendly reception staff by the way.  Our luggage was delivered to our room immediately.  We were given an ocean front room on the 11th floor and it was very nice!  The view was beautiful!!  Fridge, microwave, coffee pot, toaster.  The screened in lani was awesome!  Spent a lot of time out there in the evening.  The beach was fabulous, although I thought the prices for the lounge chairs and umbrella on the beach were a little much.  Our boys utilized the pool almost everyday and that too was very nice.  The housekeeping staff were great.  Kept our room very…

title: Best resort in florida!
review: We stayed at the Diamondhead twice. The first time it was awesome. We got an oceanfront room. It was quiet at night. Staff was friendly. Then the next year we stayed at a different resort just to try something new. It was just ok. The next year we went back to the Diamondhead resort. Try it! You won't be disappointed.

title: FREE FOR ALL
review: Stayed over the easter weekend.  Open house, they never check who is around the pool area, all the locals use it for free, bring their own music and play it loudly. take over the pool and restrooms with their kids.  No shade area, no umbrellas around the pool, too cramped. Asked for a quiet room and got one above the bar!   Never again. Just FYI, the rooms are clean and tidy, and the location is handy for the restaurants/nightlife in Ft Myers.

title: Great location, great service, great time--don't let reviews scare you.
review: I understand how our guest reviewer can have this perception over the Easter Weekend period as we were sold out over these dates. A number of families were staying with us who, in some cases, invited friends and other family members staying at other properties, to relax and enjoy the surroundings with them. Although we do patrol our pool, parking and food and beverage areas on a continuous basis I do not believe in telling our guests that they can not invite another family member to the Resort. Spring Break is a busy period for us....for our guests looking for peace and relaxation I always recommend and invite them to join us before mid March and a week after Easter. Regarding the lack of umbrellas we have several around the pool deck....regarding locals bringing their own music we restrict to personal music devices with earphones as we play light caribbean music around the pool and in the pool bar.

title: nice,but scary
review: We were a little wary of staying at the hotel because of previous bad reviews but ended up having a great time at a great place.  I particularly joined tripadvisor to be able to cmment and offset the bad reviews.  The hotel staff were prompt, courteous and friendly. Randy the cabana boy provided excellent service.  The spacious room was thoroughly cleaned every day.  We were on 7th floor but our room was not a recently renovated one.  It was still in great condition.  We had a great view looking towards towards the gulf, the beach, and times square.  The pool was not overcrowded despite many spring breakers.  The pool entertainment was very good.  Ordering food at poolside was delicious and convenient.  Great location, great service, great time.  We got a great price for the…

title: Good for families
review: stayed for 2 weeks, room was ok but tired looking, view was amazeing from balcony,staff were pleasant.We wouldnt go back here because the beach was used by local dog owners as a dog toilet !!! we saw it happen every morning,they parked their cars and got their dog or dogs out of the back, walked them on the beach to do their doggy business (not bothering to clean it up) and then got back into their cars and drove off !!!! every single day we were there we saw this happening, shame on you Fort Myers residents !!!! put us of  from going back.

title: Great place to stay - but set realistic expecations.
review: Stayed 3/9-24/10 and had a great time (2nd time). Entire hotel staff was very friendly, courteous and prompt thru ought our stay including check-in and check- out. Stayed in our somewhat overpriced room on 9th floor in 903 with pool/beach view. Rooms need some serious appliance updating. Unfortunately, our room was next to the 'slow' elevators and you could hear continued thumping thru the walls - both day and night. Opening the patio doors muffled the sound, with the rythmic gulf waves, but the trade off is tobacco smoke found it's way into our 'smoke free' rooms - since they let you smoke on the balconies. Entire facilty should be smoke free (i.e. Marriot). Hotel is about a 3/4 mile leisurely walk to the activity hub known as Time Square. We found plenty to see and do and…

title: Definately not a resort feel...more of a hotel feel...area is not very nice
review: After reading all the reviews and seeing the pictures online I felt okay to book a stay at the Diamondhead Beach Resort for a mother - daughter get away.  The area is not what we expected.  You'll find places like hooters and bars but nothing fancy.  Our idea of a vacation is getting a little dressed up and going to dinner.  This area did not offer that.  It has beach shops but nothing upscale at all!!  The hotel pool looked onto a parking lot.  When we arrived there was no valet, and no one to help with our luggage.  We found a phone nearby and the front desk told us we can just drag our suitcases up.  The hotel staff at the front desk was very helpful and accomodating and let us cancel our reservation last minute when we decided this place was not right for us.  We arrived at…

title: Pool area overrun by local high school kids (not paying guests!!)
review: Each day of our stay the local high school kids would enter the pool area and overtake it over in the afternoon, scaring the paying guests away.   Hotel staff does nothing to monitor the area, so  the kids just stroll in and out.  By evening they had their coolers (which are prohibited from the pool area) and the entire pool/hot tub area was taken over.  This happened on a daily basis over the entire week of our stay.  There NEEDS to be a key to access the pool area to keep these kids away!  Perhaps the person attempting to sell the condos at the resort needs to be watching who enters the pool area.    The pools were well heated and the location is excellent.  Our rooms were newly refurbished...but our one room was NOT cleaned before our arrival!!  There was hair in the bed,…

title: Needs updated badly
review: I appreciate this guests concern as it is one of ours as well. We do have a pool attendent checking the area throughout the day but have also found our guests do not want to be continually bothered by us asking whether they are a guest at the hotel. Because of this we also have a pool towel system in place for our guests. In addition, we are also open to them inviting friends and family to enjoy the vacation experience with them and this could possibly be what this reviewer had observed. We will continue to monitor our pool area to maintain the privacy of our Resort guests. Thank you for your feedback.

title: You can do better
review: COULD BE a wonderful place if was updated!!! Nice view with screened in lani.  Nice clean pool and hot tubs. BUT needs updated badly!!  Room was very very dated!  Furniture VERY VERY worn and stained.  Old TV sets - no flat screen.  Kitchen appliances need replaced.  Coffee maker, toaster, dishes - all have seen their days (didn't use)!!  Cabinet doors broke. Kitchen sink very stained and nasty. Lighting in all rooms very inadequate - With all the lights on could not read newspaper or magazine because they were so dim.  Bed linens were pitifully worn --- holes in the sheets - miss matched - and dirty white and pitifully thin - could read thru them.  Suggestion - if update - add a safe in the room and magnifying mirror in bathroom.  It is not worth the price in the state it is in…

title: A good hotel for a family with a toddler
review: My husband, 23 month old daughter and I stayed at the DiamondheadHotel for five nights   We stayed in the premium suite that had a full kitchenette. All of the suites had a nice size balcony with silding glass doors in both the bedroom and the living room. The bathroom had entrences from the kitchen/lving area and the bedroom. All of these features were helpful for us since we have a toddler with an early bed time that take aftnernoon naps. Our only complaint about the room was that there was very little overhead lighting and the lighting in both rooms was inadequate.   The hotel staff was helpful and prompt. The gym was adequate and the pool/hot tubs were nice. The hotel is located within walking distance to a number of restaurants. Ft. Myers beach is a very developed, so there…

title: all the care about is $ and sale of condo
review: just trying to sell a condo unit, so the guy in the booth does his quick talk, schedules an appointment and makes his money. Then you take the the time from your vacation to go and then they check your status find out first by looking at you questioning in their mind the fancy so called condo sales lady if you qualify and make enough to buy or not, promise you a free beach towel with appt.  When they find out that maybe your income isn't to their loan specs after the fact turn you away. So now you have wrecked your vacation day with planning to do this and after the fact tell you you won't qualify, how do they know I'm not sitting on cash to purchase what-ever I want? Needless to say women diss us and I in return let her know how wrong they were , then I asked if my daughter…

title: Great for families
review: Our philosophy is to offer and extend our guests a get-away of relaxation. We do not practice the high pressure sales tactics that most Vacation Ownership properties put in place. Instead we offer those interested guests an opportunity to save on future vacations. We understand that Vacation Ownership is not for everyone and manage ourselves accordingly.

title: Never Again
review: Stayed for two nights with our teenage daughters in december. We didn´t book ahead but were able to get a nice apt on the eigth floor at a really good price. Our friend traveling with us got the next apt, with adjoining balconies. We could easily walk to nearby restaurants and there was a Publixstore only a short drive away. The only thing one might complain about was the lack of a real stove. But most of the restaurants seemed to have decent prices. The view from our balcony was great and we could watch the dolphins jump.

title: STAY AWAY!!!!!!
review: After doing a search on the Internet, I came across the Diamond Head Website. The pictures and the location (on the Gulf) make it appealing. I requested a "higher floor" and they give me a room on the 9th floor..not too bad. The view was to the Southwest and although we could not see the sunset from the room or our balcony, we could see in from the outer passage ways. The room it self was ok, but the "ICE", a computer to be use by guest for information about the hotel and the area, was not working.   One evening we received a notice, slid under the door, that the water would be shut off between the hours of 2:30am and 5am, due to a maintenance issue. Well, at 3am the fire alarms went off and we had to evacuate the hotel. And since we were on the 9th floor, we had to walk down…

title: Fine hotel
review: For the price, this was a fine hotel.  We got a room with a partial view of the ocean which was nice.  There was really nothing wrong with the place.  I would most likley not come back just because of the price and would look for something cheaper as we only slept in our room.  The beach next the hotel was nice but smelled like sewage a little...

title: Stay elsewhere
review: For a bit more money- stay elsewhere. Very dated hotel. Should be more like a two star.  Noisy, crowded, fairly rough area. Nothing redeeming about this facility for family.

title: Know what you're getting first...
review: Read all the reviews: some helpful, some not. 1st time felt compelled to write a review. Mixed reactions: room not exactly as pictured (no granite countertops, no flatscreen tv's: those are for PREMIUM rooms...which I signed up for...but only on floors 4 and 7) Room was spacious, did get high room (8th floor) as requested, asked for corner room away from pool to decrease possible noise but was told that rooms assigned night before and by special request. (?) Did get other corner room which ended being fine. Hotel is NOISY because of cement construction. Noisy upstairs neighbor...hardwood furniture noise on tile flooring translates right thru floor. Also, voices echo down hallways since no carpeting. Not unhappy...spacious rooms, great location just down a bit from "adult spring…

title: LOVE this place
review: This place is just great!  We were offered two rooms, and the staff let us check them both out.  They were both amazing!  The rooms are so nice!  The balconies are HUGE with lounge chairs and a regular patio table with chairs.  Nice beach access and nice pool.  They have this great thing in the rooms called "ICE".  It is a computer (touch screen) with built in amenities such as concierge, reservations, things to do, and more.  We even won a souvenir beach towel when we were there which was nice!

title: Great hotel!
review: The hotel is really relaxing and the location is perfect! Our room had a beautiful view of the ocean and was pretty spacious. It was the perfect choice for our much-needed getaway!The staff was very friendly as well. My favorite part was the fact that I could request room service on the touchscreen that is provided in the room. The menu was there and it was really easy and convenient to use. The touchscreen also had lots of information about the area on it, too, which was pretty helpful. Overall, it was a great stay and I would stay at DiamondHead again in a heartbeat!

title: No Amenities.....No Service
review: The staff is courteous and eager to please, but entirely unhelpful when it came to fulfilling even the most basic requests. I asked the concierge to recommend a good restaurant, and she told me to eat in the hotel's dining room (the food there is inedible by the way...even the fruit...and its Florida!). I asked the bellman, at the referral of the concierge, to tell me of any places in the area that served cappuccino (the hotel does not) and he told me, "If you are looking for gourmet coffee you could try the bagel shop down road but I doubt they have it."  There is no concept of service, and if you make what the staff considers "special requests," they are not only unhelpful but act as if you are spoiled. There are NO amenities. No minibar, no toothbrush, no pen, no…

title: Good Choice
review: Used our time-share sort of on the spur of the moment, nice hotel, attractive rooms and great king-sized bed.  The staff was very nice and we had a pleasant stay.  Beautiful views of the ocean from our screened in balcony, pool could use some landscaping attention, but was clean and pleasant.  We did not use the beach chairs, I refuse to pay $25/day, it would be ok for a couple of days but not a week.  Restaurants & drinks were fine.  Not connected to the hotel but just a beware to others - the casino boat is as you would expect a major rip off.  They waive the fees give you a meal that was actually quite good but you pay dearly for it, we never won a penny.

title: Perfect Beachside Wedding Getaway
review: My Aunt chose the DiamondHead for her beachside wedding, and I could not think of a better location!  The staff was incredibly friendly and accomodating and the setting amazing.  We ended up with a corner room, which I highly recommend requesting.  The breezes through both sides of the screened patio were refreshing in the summer heat.  The room was spacious and well set-up, the kitchenette a plus.  Just watch the edge of the patio doors, there's a lip up that isn't clearly highlited and the bride limped down the beach wtih a broken toe as a result.  The DiamondHead has a great setting, just on the edge of the touristy section of town.  It was quiet enough and safe for family members of all ages to wander around.  Although the ocean isn't the clearest at this point, there's a…

title: On the beach with a great view
review: It's great to wake up in the morning and look out over the gulf of Mexico and be able to walk the shore along the sand, the staff here was friendly and full of info about  local spots and late night eateries that should not be missed. loved it

title: Very happy with our pick!
review: Very clean. Awesome customer service.We even received a phone call per day just to make sure we were happy.  The one bedrom suite was large and had everything we  needed. We were shocked with how large thne balcony was. The location was walking distance from the busy area (the Pier).  If you stay here, you have to walk the block and a half to have breakfast at Heavenly Bisquit (don't pass on their famous cinammon roll)! For a great relaxing and fun hangout at night, go to Cabasca's (ask for Steve or Danielle!)

title: Excellent Hotel, fantastic Location, home from home.
review: My Wife Julie and I had stayed at Fort Myers Beach before on many occasions, this was our first timt at the DiamondHead Beach Resort. We were welcomed by friendly Staff at the reception, we were chilled out straight away. When we saw our room we were totally gobsmacked. It was on the third floor and the balcony overloked the sea, that view and those sunsets made it even more spectacular.                               Friendly staff, fantastic food, our experience made us so happy that we booked our return visit as soon as we got home to the UK. We are returning on 5th November 2009 for another two glorious weeks, can`t wait to be back there!!!

title: Love it, but TOO hot in August!
review: First, should mention that three of the floors in the building have been converted to time-share condos, and we "exchanged in" (7th Floor).  There is a small (but sufficient) kitchen with 2 burners, microwave, small fridge, pots and plates and utensils, etc., dining table, etc.  I loved that there were 4 big cushy beach towels in the unit at check-in, so we could each use 1 for the shower and 1 for the beach.  The king-size bed was probably one of the most comfortable beds I've ever encountered in a time-share or hotel, and the bed linens were extraordinary.  We had a big screened-in balcony, with table, 4 chairs, and 2 adjustable lounge-chairs with little end-table thing; great place for breakfast and watching the lightning-storms at night!  I would definitely go here again,…

title: GET NEW BEACH CHAIRS!!
review: I read reviews of this resort before I went  and one review mentioned the uncomfortable and old beach chairs but I didnt realize the importance of this detail.  This is a beach resort which means you are spending all the time on the beach.  The chairs are the average resort price of 2 chairs and an umbrella for $25.00 which I would not have minded paying since I feel it is part of my vacation to not have to shlep chairs down to the beach every day; however these chairs are the most uncomfortable chairs that I have ever sat in.  They are  old wooden chairs with a canvas sling and a foot rest  that hooks on to a wooden bar that hits you right on the back of your legs (ow!) They do not recline more than a small tilt so forget about a snooze and you absolutely cannot lie on your…

title: Very nice but very expensive compared to the alternatives
review: Diamond Head is a nice resort. The rooms aren't a very resort feel with tvs from 1980 and outdated bathrooms. The view, however is spectacular. We had some dirty dishes sitting around when we got there which was kind of weird. It seemed their staff didnt fully look at everything, for instance our cutting board looked like a pizza had just been made on it. The food here is outstanding and very reasonably priced however drinks are extremely high. They give you some coupons upon check in that help ease this but regardless, they are what they are. These are all me being very picky as I still give the place a 4 out of 5. Great views, wonderful beach, attentive staff, and outstanding food. I would recommend it for sure.

title: WONDERFUL!
review: Beautiful Grounds, Great beach, comfortable rooms, great views.would stay again.

title: Good time place
review: Had a great time.....suite was very nice....not PLUSH.....but I could have stayed and stayed....didn't want to go home.  Very family oriented.  However, my husband and I were alone.  Kids did not bother us.  Drove to Naples for several fine dining restaurants.  It was a great getaway, and we would stay there again.

title: Great Staff and Service
review: We stayed here for a family reunion, and I must say that the staff were exceptional to a person. All smiling, helpful people, and a joy to be with. The food was excellent for banquet food, what particularly impressed me was that one of the buffet items was a NY Strip Steak which was done to perfection - very uncommon in a buffet format. The only downside was a seasonal odor which made the beach less appetizing. The service, food, and general staff friendliness outweighed that small inconvenience.

title: Excellent second stay, can't wait to come back
review: I was just looking thru reviews for Ft. Myers Beach, and realized that I didn't leave a review of our second stay at Diamond Head!  First time was just the wife and I on our honeymoon one year previous ( you can find my old review on the site posted about Jul 2007).   This time we took our 2 teenage girls with us, and booked Beach Shell Inn for a full week.  Go figure... we found a much cheaper flight that allowed us to spend two extra days (9 days instead of 7), so it was a no brainer for us.  We booked our extra two nights at Diamond Head, still saved money AND  got to spend two extra days at the beach! The staff was awesome.  When booking by phone, I got a disount for being a repeat customer, and after arrival one of the ladies working the bar actually remembered my wife and…

title: Still the Best!
review: Stayed here in November and I liked it so much I wanted to come back when it was hot out. Return trip was in June and it was fantastic. It's nice to be at a hotel where things are taken care of and the people are pleasant.  Had a room with a direct ocean view straight over the pool on the 11th floor. Never heard a peep from the pool, even with the sliding glass open. Actually got to use the AC on this trip, worked great and not loud. Pool area was great, get out there and you can avoid the little kids for a while (if that's what you're after). Poolside service from Cabana's is fantastic (Christy is the best).  My only criticism would be the service they have some type of relationship with for beach chairs. Those chairs are terrible and for $25 bucks you think they would rake the…

title: Very nice place
review: We stayed for the third year in a row in early June.  All the rooms are all actually the  same size,  we were upgraded to a beachfront suite and although it was appreciated,  I would not pay the extra money for it.  I have no problem with the gulfview suite. The rooms were clean and the maids did a very good job each day.  They make towel animals for the kids, we requested a few more and she was happy to make them for my daughter.  The value was great,  check their website for some deals.  I found if you book 21 day advance to best the best deal.  Once you have stayed there you can usually get a past guest discount also.  The pool area is very nice and very close to the beach.  There is the Cabana bar right at the pool for drinks and a decent lunch menu.  My wife and daughter…

title: 10yr Anniversary ......
review: We stayed here for our 10yr Anniversary and thought that the resort itself was GREAT !!! The staff was great from the time we checked in until the time we left.  The suite that we stayed in was very nice and had everything that we could ever need to make our stay a great one. From the room itself to the Gulf view. The one bad experience that we had, although it lasted all weekend, was the fact that they were dredging the bay behind the resort and pumping sand and seagrass into the ocean about 200 feet off of the shore right in front of the resort.  Seagrass started washing in on Saturday morning and layed on the beach the whole time we were there and by the time we left (we were there 4 days) the seagrass was around 20" deep, 4-5 feet across and as far as one could see in both…

title: Outstanding hotel, excellent service and housekeeping
review: I rarely can write a review without a complaint.  However, Diamondhead earned A++ rating from myself and my husband.  This was a great place to spend our honeymoon.  At check in, we were greeted by staff who were most eager to help.  Check in was a breeze.  Our room was very nice.  Clean, very comfortable and just like home away from home.  I must say, I have never had a more comfortable night of sleep.  My only complaint would have been the coffee maker.  I called the front desk at 5am and said the water reservoir looked yucky.  Jeremy (at the front desk) said he would have maintenance replace it later in the day when they were in.  He made a fresh pot of decaf in the lobby and invited me down to grab a cup.  I think that was an excellent solution, despite having to get dressed…

title: Nice stay!
review: We stayed at this hotel with our two teenage boys, and are kind of travel novices. None of us had ever stayed in Florida other than with family. The plan was my husband and I would stay in the bedroom and, knowing our sons would not share a bed if it were the last bed on earth, one son would sleep on the couch and the other on the floor with the borrowed sleeping bag. Surprise. The floor was all tile, so the bed had to be shared and brotherly fights ensued. But we lived through it.  We had a fabulous end, beachfront room that curved to the west, so we also got the sunsets. Other than that, the price of the room was spendy for us and I'm not sure it was worth the premium price. The bedroom had a comfy bed but the pillows were terrible and the carpet was dirty. The bathroom was…

title: Diamondhead- Great Location, Great Room, Awesome View
review: Stayed at DiamondHead for 3 nights.  Family with 3 kids.  (yes, you can sneak an extra kid into your room.)  Ours are young, didn't want to book a separate room, so just checked in with two.  Loved the rooms.  Great balcony- we were up on the 11th floor- do request a high room.  View is amazing.  Pool and Gulf View.  Take the hotel tour- you can get $100 dollars to spend- or to take off your hotel bill.  The small family run Cuban restaurant across the street (upstairs from the TATOO) is a GREAT place to eat.  Made fresh for you.  Nice music.  Eat indoors or outdoors. Watch the sunset. Great fresh Grouper.  Also kid friendly food.   We ate there every night.  You can call them and they will also deliver directly to your room in the hotel.  They are the BEST!

title: Nice hotel, restaurants not so good
review: The hotel location was great, the rooms were clean and the views from the balcony were fantastic.  The pool and bar area were also nice.  My only complaint was the food from the hotel restaurants.  The service was fine but the quality of the food itself seemed to be lacking.

title: Spacious Suites but everthing else average
review: We looked at this facility last year while staying elsewhere on Fort Myers Beach and liked the unit they showed us. So we decided to give it a try this year.  All units are one bedroom suites with King beds, living rooms, kitchen areas and spacious balconies.  Other things, however, prevent me from giving a higher rating.  First, this is a full service hotel with bar, restaurant, and banquet facilities.  When there are functions going on, the available parking is inadequate.  Twice we had to try to find alternative parking which is near impossible on the beach.  The Diamond Head is also a time share building and we were stopped numerous times (and called in our room) by employees urging us to attend their Open House - which is a quick tour and then an hour long sales pitch.  We…

title: great time, very nice hotel...don coon rapids mn.
review: had a great time. weather was cold for Florida but hotel and staff were great, kids loved the pool and beach, our room was wonderful..will stay again..........

title: Clean, Stylish and Comfortable
review: Clean, Stylish and Comfortable  I like the modern style through out the resort. My room was a 1 bedroom with a kitchen and living room area. It had a pull out couch. Every thing was very new looking and well decorated. They pay attention to detail. It reminded me of the cruise ship but nicer. The food at the pool deck was very good and not too much money.   I would recommend it to every one of all ages and backgrounds.  They have meeting rooms for events, meetings and weddings.

title: Just booked reservations for our 4th year!
review: We have been 3 years in a row!!   A wonderful beach hotel.. So much room in the suites.. All the restaurants our great...We have never had a bad experience...My daughter who is 8 goes and has a great time... We live in the Tampa area just miles from the beach...this is a gorgeous location at an affordable cost.... Can't wait to go again!!

title: Horrible place at an inflated price
review: Overpriced, dirty, and incompent!    My new wife and I booked this hotel for one night so that we could stay over for the ferry to Key West to start our honeymoon.  Thank God we just booked for that one night!  The place was incredibly overpriced, dingy, dirty, and on top of everything else the woman who checked us in at the front desk was rude and completely incompetent.  She kept insisting that we were staying for seven days and were from Ontario (we were from Florida and staying one night),   Two days later, I had to interrupt my honeymoon to call and dispute a 350 dollar charge on my checking account that I had not authorized.  The nasty manager who answered the phone argued with me for ten minutes before finally admitting it was the resort's fault, but I still had to jump…

title: Great one night stay - found by accident
review: Came to Ft. Myer area to look at real estate.  Was only supposed to stay one night.  Ventured down to Ft. Myers Beach just to look around and decided to stay another night.  Found rate for Diamondhead on my mobile phone and my husband booked the room - just stayed one night but this is a fine hotel.  Great room/suite, great pool, great location.  Will go back.

title: absolutely a favorite
review: I absolutely love this hotel. I went with my family of four and we met up with another family of four while we were there. The pool area was perfect for relaxing under the sun. We went from the beach to the pool all day long. The cabana was nice but slow, but it was fine for us because we weren't in any hurry. We had a view facing directly toward the ocean on the third floor. It was amazing. The only problem with that spot was the door to that hall slammed if the balcony door was open, so be aware of that. This is a perfect vacation spot if your just in the need for some relaxation and tanning in the day, and good restaurants and fun near the hotel at night.  Also, there is a great dolphin tour available on jet skis. It is absolutely worth the cost!! check it out  great for all…

title: Great sunsets
review: We've stayed at the Diamondhead twice - Sept 2006 and Sept 2007. Both for 4 nights as part of a fly-drive holiday.   The hotels is nice with plenty of car parking, right on the beach. the rooms are a suite with kitchen, lounge, bedroom and bathroom. the hotel is one of few high rise hotels along the beach so is easy to find when you know what to look for.   Always ask for a gulf view room and the sunsets are amazing! last time we were there we got a room on the opposite side of the hotel but we asked to be moved and reception were happy to do so. i think the beach also has turtles and you're asked not to leave balcony lights on as this distracts them but unfortunatly we didn't get to see any  the hotel restaurant, think its called Choles, was also nice and we ate here a couple…

title: Really Really nice resort....
review: 4 girls stayed at the Diamondhead Beach Resort for a girls vacation in mid October. It was a really nice resort... Great Service, Friendly Staff... Only issue was poolside service and bar there, the staff there was really rude and refused to ackowlege we were there.  Other than that, great hotel... Would stay again.

title: Great Hotel
review: My husband and I stayed three nights at the DiamondHead in October, 2008.  I booked at the last minute using the hotel website and got a great deal.  We stayed in room 711 which is on the outside of the building at the back.  The room had a large balcony with excellent views and lovely patio furniture -- a table and chairs plus two loungers.  Everything in the room was in very good condition.  The only thing I would even remotely complain about is the bathroom door -- it's a slider which seems like a major design mistake for a bathroom door since you open and close it often and end up wrestling with it to get it all the way open or closed. We did not visit Chloe's because we did not have a good experience there on a previous visit to the hotel.  This was our second visit to the…

title: nice hotel
review: good location  nice large rooms  lots of vouchers in your reception pack   only down side is that their is "time sharerooms " on several of the hotel floors" staff keen for customers to go to viewing receptions

title: Great Rooms
review: The stay at Diamondhead was great. The staff was very helpful and kind. I loved the room, there was a livingroom, at small kitchen, the bedroom, a great bathroom, and a double balcony with a beautiful view. I would definatley go back to this hotel.

title: Can't wait to go back
review: Diamondhead was the perfect vacation spot to relax after our sons wedding. The views were gorgeous, the staff friendly and full of  great advice. The rooms were spacious enough for a family of 4. Crafts in the afternoon were a nice treat for our 8 year old daughter. Our 16 year old was able to walk into town to meet other relatives.   We went from the pool to the beach all day. Chris working at the waverunner/sand chair stand was awesome and just an all around great guy.   And don't worry about leaving food in your fridge, the housekeeping staff is more than happy to bring your leftovers home!

title: Beach, Sunshine, Pina Coladas and The DiamondHead..What more could a Girl want?
review: I had been to the DiamondHead years ago, right after it opened and when My mother, Sister and I decided to take a MOM-Daughter vacation, the DiamondHead was the first on my list. Although I was afraid that the tropical storm Faye may ruin our plans,  I kept in touch with the DiamondHead and when they told me to come on down that they were fine and Faye was past then we headed out. And I was so glad we chose there to stay again. From the time we stepped out of the taxi, to the time we left to come home, the staff was wonderfu!. We had a awesome view from the 5th floor where we had a beachfront-pool suite. The screened in porch was great as when we had to much sun we hung out there. I cannot say enough about 2 servers at the Cabana Bar and Grill. Gale and Cheryl made it so much…

title: honeymoon
review: My wife and I stayed here on the second week of our honeymoon. On arrival we were surprised to see comfortable seats in the garage area. We later discovered it was a good place to discuss the information given to us by the helpful bellman. On checking in we were asked if we would like a lower room (12th to 2nd) due to the impending hurricane Fay and could move back up later if we wished. The corridors take some getting used too, being dark green pebble dashed walls with doors like entrances too cells, but don’t be deterred. The rooms are spacious with TV sofa and a balcony with sun lounges and tables. A small kitchenette with a fridge microwave and dishwasher come in handy. The bedroom has a 7ft bed, wardrobe and plenty or drawer space. Bathroom is also spacious with shower over…

title: Would stay here again
review: This hotel is great, I can't understand why some people complain about it. The rooms are clean and spacious and the kitchenette is very handy. We were on the top floor and the views of the gulf were fantastic, Estero Blvd was also visible from the spacious balcony. Shops and restaurants are within walking distance about 1/2 mile.   The restaurant staff were very helpful when we arrived at the hotel very late after a long day travelling, the restaurant had just closed but they were happy to accommodate us. The front desk staff were also very happy to help us with any queries we had especially when we needed to find a doctor just before we left for home.  Shopping outlets are only about 4miles away but I have to say the Miromar Outlets were bigger and better. We also loved Coconut…

title: Awesome, friendly & fun
review: My wife & I stayed here in the middle of June. My wife never saw the ocean before. We wanted the "Best room in the hotel" I was assured that we would be taken care of. From the moment we arrived to the very last minute of our stay we were pampered by the staff and management. Our view from the 12th floor over looking the gulf was exactly what I was promised. As long as we continue to vacation at Ft Myers Beach we will not stay anywhere else!!!

title: Definitely a three star hotel
review: The DiamondHead Beach Resort is a nice, three-star hotel.  The rooms are nothing fancy, but are fine for a short stay.  They do have a great screened-in balcony with plenty of furniture.  The small kitchenette was useful for the fridge.  There are ice machines on every other floor, so we didn't have one on our floor and the one above us was broken.  We stayed in a handicapped room, but I am unsure of how someone in a wheelchair would have navigated the bathroom/bedroom very well as it was a bit cramped.  The bathroom was nothing fancy, but there was plenty of hot water with Bath and Body Works toiletries.  The housekeeping staff was very friendly, but we had to ask them to change the sheets.  Also, when we requested an internet cord because the wireless was not working, they…

title: Awesome Hotel!
review: We just returned from a week at Diamond Head. The hotel is terrific and the service was incredible - from the bell staff to the front desk to the wait staff and cleaning crew - all were friendly, accomodating and made me feel that I really mattered to them. We took advantage of almost every offering, including the water sports, which were great! The pool atmosphere is relaxing yet fun, and the food at both Cabana's and Chloe's was very good - I was surprised, in fact, at how good it was - you don't often find that in hotel restaurants.  Because every room is a suite, it made staying here for a week feel like home.  Having traveled extensively for business and pleasure, I am very picky when it comes to hotels, but Diamond Head exceeded my expectations .  I would HIGHLY recommend,…

title: Loved It!
review: We arrived to Ft Myers Beach after staying in a very small room at Disney with my wife and 2 kids. We were very happy to find the roomy suite waiting for us with a great view.
