We took advantage of the pool as did a lot of other people at the resort. The only complaint we had was that housekeeping did not clean our room. It was a mix up as our 17 yr old son did not move the "Do Not Disturb" sign in time like he should of while we were at the pool. I had to go ask for towels which were brought to the room quickly. We definitely will return and for a longer period of time.

title: Wonderful Experience
review: My wife and I stayed at the Diamond Head resort June 14-21.  We were both extremely pleased with the entire experience.  The rooms are spacious and clean.  The kitchenette is really handy.  I fell asleep on the screened-in patio 4 nights just listening to the small waves on the beach. The hotel is within walking distance to shopping and restaurants.  I would guess about 1/2 mile to the pier.   We can't wait to go back!!!

title: lazy vacation
review: stayed at daimond head ft. myers68-6-12-2008.  read many reviews first.  Let me tell you the rooms are very nice not 5star but very comfortable.  the balconies are in living area and bedroom.  you can lay in bed and see the ocean.  the hotel and restaurant staff are Very nice.  the beach and the water are very clean.  you can go way out into the water .  no waves.  the              main restaurant very expensive.  the trolley can take you up and down main road.  If you want to sight see you either need a car or make arrangements throuth the concerge.  If you want to relax lay on the beach and have a good meal it is the place to be.

title: Excellent
review: My fiancee and I came to Florida to plan our destination wedding. We stayed at another hotel to try and get some other options. On our arrivial to a different hotel, we were horrified. We immediately contacted the DiamondHead to see if there were any rooms available. The staff there at the DiamondHead bent over backwards to make sure that our stay was incredible. They were all friendly and even took the time to learn our names. We originally were planning on a different hotel after the first night, however we decided to stay the entire vacation. By the time we left, most everyone at the resort knew our name. They made our vacation/wedding planning/and my fiancee's birthday the best trip it could have been. I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

title: Great Sister Getaway
review: Here for 5 nights for our first ever sister getaway.  Staff very friendly and helpful - early checkin allowed.  Our corner room on the 9th floor was oceanfront - awesome views.  Good food in hotel.  Only drawback was sofa bed was very uncomfortable.  Excellent restaurant recommendations!  Will be back.  Resort employees very appreciative of our patronage.

title: Descrimination!!!
review: Well my best friend and I were trying to get a hotel for one night for the night of our graduation. It was supposed to be an all girls trip before we went away to college. We took the time to drive an hour over to the hotel and once we got there they said we needed someone 25 or over to put a credit card up in case of any damages. We told them not a problem. We then had one of our parents drive over an hour to the hotel. Once she got there, the manager then said that she changed her mind and wouldnt let us stay there unless we had the mother stay with us because we looked like(and I quote) " A bunch of  alcohol drinking, party it up kind of kinds and thats not what she wanted at her resort." She was extremely unprofessional and even after we comlied with everything she said and…

title: In need of refurbishment
review: From our arrival to departure we found the staff to be very friendly and helpful. The hotel in general and our room were in need of refurbishment, the kitchenette in particular.  The sun beds on the beach were very tatty and were overpriced considering you could not even lay flat. The above two issues can and should be dealt with by management; the pictures shown on the Diamondhead web site are deceiving.

title: Superb Stay.....
review: Firstly every ones aspirations are different. We've been lucky enough to stay in some beautiful locations across the world and having read some of the previous comments on both the resort and the hotel we were a little concerned. Concerned? Why? The hotel/apartments as that is what they are, really are fantastic. We didn't have a room with a view of the sunset but a view of the Gulf made up for that which is what we requested, I'm sure all rooms get the sunshine at some time during the day. There was an ongoing supply of hot water night and day and the bath was large and extremely relaxing.  The seperate bedroom had a king size bed which allows you to be as close or as far apart as is your choice! I read someone mention valet parking was missing from the hotel. I'm not quite…

title: Fabulous resort terrific staff
review: The hotel is beautiful,the view from my suite was fabulous and very accurate. The entire staff from the bellman who opened my cab door as I arrived , the girls at check in, the housekeeper were so friendly . I received excellent service from everyone,and will definitely be returning to Diamondhead in the future..

title: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay
review: Having done a lot of research on Fort Myers Beach, we chose the DiamondHead Resort because of the size of the rooms, the queen sofa-bed for our daughter, and the size of the balcony overlooking the gulf.  We stayed in a premium ocean-front suite, and the sunsets from the balcony were amazing.   We enjoyed our week very much, and the DiamondHead fulfilled our expectations very nicely.      I guess I'm really writing this review in response to the one that says 'refused to stay', because my family couldn't disagree more with it!    The pool was heated to a very comfortable temperature and was superb.  Very clean, kid-friendly since it's no more than 5 1/2 feet deep at either end, and a wonderful place to have a late night swim while looking up at the stars.    We only ate on-site…

title: Refused to stay
review: We arrived at this hotel after an amazing week in Disney Land.  We have stayed in Naples at the Edgewater Beach Hotel before, and I wanted to try somewhere different, but with the same concept (big room with kitchen area).  I didn't realise about the price and quality difference between Fort Myres and Naples.    I'm afraid that we walked in, HATED it beyond belief, from first impression, and left as soon as we saw the room.  The fact that it was 10.00pm at night, we had just had a long drive, and the children were begging to sleep, shows how desperate we were to escape.  There was a tattoo parlour opposite, the exterior looked like a car park, and the inside like a grey concrete prison.  The room was basic, damp and the sofa bed was not fit to be called a sofa, let alone a bed. …

title: Perfect vacation - great place to stay
review: My husband and I traveled to Fort Myers Beach to celebrate his 40th birthday and check out spring training.  Everything was great - from the pool to the beach to the staff - couldn't be nicer :)  Our room was clean and huge.  A separate bedroom -  sitting room with couch and a kitchenette.  The sunsets from the patio were beautiful.  Our room has a partial view of the ocean and I wouldn't choose to pay more for a full view -this was perfect.    Highly recommend this place!!

title: really enjoyed our stay here  website pics very accurate
review: had a great stay    our room looked exactly like the website        no surprises    everything was clean and in new condition      hotel staff were very nice and helpful     great location on beach    one negative was cover for pool filters were open and since we were on the second floor the hum was annoying out on the balcony  (which was huge and screened )     front desk had maintenance go down right away and shut cover eliminating noise    definitely would stay there again  as it was one of the nicest hotels in the area       best places to watch sunsets were the pier at times square and lovers key state park

title: Nice beachfront hotel
review: First, can I just address a lot of the negative reviews about this place? If you read them, the reviewers liked the Diamondhead, but didn’t like Fort Meyers. Well, if you wanted Naples but were too cheap to pay for it, don’t complain about it. Fort Meyers and Naples  are two distinct places and if you didn’t know Fort Meyers is a little more of a down and dirty party beach, that’s your problem, not the Diamondhead’s.     Second, as far as this hotel, it was a very nice place to stay. Right on Fort Meyers Beach and in easy walking distance to bars and places to eat. Of course, you can also walk to the touristy t-shirt shops and what-not that abound in this area. Rooms were extremely spacious suites, with a large living area with fridge, microwave, etc. There was a clean bathroom…

title: Great place to stay on Ft Myers Beach
review: We had a beach-view suite on the 3rd floor.  The room was very nice and clean.  The view was awesome from our screened-in deck.  We were able to watch both the sunrise and sunset from our deck.    I wouldn’t recommend any room except the beach-view rooms, because the view of the water and beach was so unobstructed and no one from other rooms can see on your deck.  The other rooms, overlooking the pool, are in an L-pattern, so all the other decks face each other.  If privacy is a concern, such as walking around with the doors open to your deck, then the beach-view room is the way to go.  Just before sundown each evening, we were entertained watching the very competent beach boy, clean up and put away all the umbrellas and chairs.  It seemed he had to argue with some lingerers…

title: Great Location
review: DiamondHead was in a great location.  10 minute walk down Estero Blvd or on the Beach to Times Square.  Many bars/eateries to stop at along the way.  Check out happy hours-usually from 3-5 or 4-7.  Times Square has all kinds of shops & restaurants/bars to enjoy.  I recommend Gulfsore Grill-all you can eat shrimp,ribs & king crab for $24.95-Really! Head south on Estero Blvd for fabulous italian food at Anthony's or great grouper tacos at the Fish House.  Each room at Diamond head has a kitchen equiped with a small fridge.  Topps Market, 7 Eleven within walking distance.  We stocked up on Beer, water & soda.  Winn DIxie & Publix easy to get to with a car. Buy your own breakfast stuff because I wasn't impressed with any breakfast.  The hotel is only $4.95 but not very good. If you…

title: Great time at Diamondhead
review: My wife and I and our 2 kids, ages 12 & 10 just returned from a week stay at DiamondHead and could not have had a more positive experience. The room was well kept and featured a dorm sized fridge, coffee maker, dishwasher and utensils. It had king size bed in the bedroom (all rooms are 1 bedroom suites) and a queen sized pull out in living room. There was a large screened in balcony and an excellent A/C unit.              The staff was great and the location cannot be beat. It is less than a mile from the Times Square area and all the restaurants/bars/shops that you could want. The beach was beautiful and clean and the pool decent sized.              Some quick grades on local eateries and bars:              Matanzas Inn-B+ Good seafood, nice ambience (Marina)             …

title: Great Hotel on The Beach
review: My husband and I celebrated our 3yr anniversary at this hotel and We were very pleased with the accomodations and staff. Everyone was friendly and seemed genuinely concerned about our stay. The spacious room and the amenities made us feel at home for the few days we were there. The sunset views were outstanding to watch on the beach and at the Cabana Bar. We would recommend this as a great, clean hotel with more to offer than a regular hotel. Worth the stay and then some.

title: Nice Hotel, Nice Beach, Rundown Town
review: The hotel is very nice!  If you are going to stay at Fort Myers Beach, stay here at Diamond Head or at the Edison Beach House (it looked real nice from the outside).  The staff at Diamond Head was very nice and helpful.  The room we stayed at was Premium Gulf view on the 4th floor.  That means that you get a room with updated appliances, and granite counters.  The room we stayed in was clean, and had a view of the beach and the pool.  The bed was okay, the shower was small - but with good water pressure, bathroom was nice, and the front room and porch also nice.  Furniture and TV was little dated.  The pool and the beach were nice.  We walked from the hotel to the pier on the beach, bring your flip-flops.  Food at the hotel was okay, but on the expensive side compare to the…

title: Clean hotel, dirty town!
review: The Diamondhead hotel is a gem in the middle of the filthy, run down area of Fort Myers Beach.  We choose the Diamondhead because we have a 2 yr old and needed a suite on the beach that was affordable.  We wanted to stay in Naples, but everything that met that criteria was too expensive.  The hotel is nice, the room was clean and had a terrific view of the ocean with a lanai.  The pool was nice and the beach in front of the hotel was clean and there were toys for our son to play with.  We had breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel every morning and the service was VERY slow.  We did ask for a crib in the room, which was there upon our arrival, but it was very small and our son was almost to big for it. That is where my good review ends.  We walked down to the Fort Myers pier…

title: Great Hotel on the Beach!!
review: My husband and I decided to take a mini-vacation to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary and decided to go to Ft. Meyers Beach.  We had never been there but made a decision to stay at Diamondhead based on TripAdvisor reviews.  The hotel is an all suite hotel with plenty of space.  There was a small kitchenette and a balcony that overlooked the pool and the Gulf.  I would stay here again!  It was right on the beach and everything was at our fingertips.  Great place to stay!  We did have a small snafu at Chloes for dinner - my husband's steak was not cooked as he had requested but we were told they had a new chef and removed it from our bill in addition to reducing our bill by 50%.    This hotel had all the amenties of home and then some.  The pool, hot tubs, beach and…

title: Diamondhead was very nice.
review: We enjoyed our stay at Diamondhead.  From check-in to check out, we never had a problem.  Rooms were as described on their website.  Service was great, everyboy was very friendly.

title: the great escape
review: spent 3 days at this hotel. accomodation was excellent ,rooms were spotless maid service was also excellent.views were stunning from our balcony and the sunsets delightful.. the kids could could have done with a games room as there was not much for them to do in the evening also i thought there restaurant prices were a bit steep $11.95 for breakfast. we had a great trip and would highly rate this hotel to anyone visiting fort myers.  kennard family dublin

title: Overall, a good experience
review: Just got back from 9 days at the Diamondhead Beach Resort.  Hotel was clean, staff was friendly and courteous and very accommodating.  The beach area is nice and just steps from the rooms. The beach bar and grill (cabanas):  food not very tasty, bland and service was pretty poor. Chloes:  Dinner was excellent and service was great, however, breakfast there was quite different.  I don't know what kind of breakfast sausage they use, but I have never tasted anything so bad in my life.  I took breakfast to go up to the room for my husband and he asked why the sausage tasted so terrible, so I know it wasn't just me.  there was quite a difference in quality and service between breakfast and dinner at Chloes. We used Holiday Watersports located at Diamonhead  and they were fantastic. …

title: Dingy
review: What a dingy hotel.  The bathtub was clogged.  The poolside tile was dirty and dingy.  I don't want to stay in a hotel where my house is cleaner than the hotel.

title: Great beach resort hotel
review: Great hotel for what we wanted, a long three day weekend. Hotel is located on a beautiful stretch of beach with safe , calm, shallow water. Rooms are 675 square feet, with a seperate bedroom , lounge with kitchen and sofa bed. Huge balconies with great views. Patio bar and food is the only thing that lets the resort down, although they have a more upscale restaurant and bar, Chloes, on the first floor, but there are tons of eating options within a short walk or drive.

title: What a great hotel!
review: We stay 5 nights at Diamondhead, What a great hotel. I think its one of the nicest hotels in Fort Myers Beach. The staff is very helpful and friendly.The hotel is located in the middle of the stores and restaurants. Housekeeping was great, wash our floors every day. There was a lot of kids at the hotel, but my boyfriend and I still had a romantic time.

title: Loved Diamondhead Resort!
review: My husband and I spent 5 nights here in May/06 for the rest of our vacation after a wedding in Baton Rouge.  We wanted relaxation on the ocean and that's exactly what we got!  Our room was on the 12th floor with fabulous panoramic views of the ocean.  It was screened in with table and chairs so we were able to have dinner out there and enjoy the sunsets.  We had a one bedroom suite which included a king sized bed, a kitchen, a sofabed and tv.  Everything was clean and well-kept and the style was up to date.  One thing about the location is that it isn't close to that many restaurants and it is necessary to have a car here.  Also, at the time, the beach was experiencing red tide which made it kind of hard to get in the ocean, but that wasn't the hotel's fault.  The pool was clean…

title: Designer Suites? Not even close...
review: Great location and a fantastic beach. That's all for the positives. This is not a "resort" by any stretch of the imagination. The "suites" are as basic as you can get. The bed and sofa were both very stiff and uncomfortable. The sheets and towels were very poor quality. The staff was pretty much invisible the entire 5 days we were there. The pool was nice,  but the drinks and food at the cabana bar were nothing special and with the invasion of the "love bugs" during our stay the entire facility looked very unsanitary.  Do not accept a room on the second floor -- this is where the laundry and housekeeping are and they drag stuff in and out all day and into the evening on carts with what sounds like metal wheels. The view does not make up for the noise.  Check the NOAA website for…

title: Very PLeased with Diamond Head
review: We just returned from a week stay at the Diamond Head Beach resort and overall found the experience very pleasing.   We had a one bedroom gulf-view suite that was really nice.  We were traveling with a 10-month old and the hotel was able to provide us with both a travel crib and highchair for our room.  The room was an exact replica of the room featured on the hotels website so you can look at the website and know exactly what to expect.  The hotel facilities were very nice especially when compared to the surrounding inns and hotels, which seemed to be much older and rundown.  The pool area was very nice and we never had any trouble finding a poolside chair although we were traveling during the off-season.  The ocean is just steps away from this hotel, which makes things easier…

title: Sweet Suite Beach-front Resort with warm saline pool!
review: We were very pleased with Diamondhead.  The staff went out of their way in friendliness.  The onsite dining has good variety & smelled great (we didn't eat it though).  Beach is nice--waves are flat great for kids.  The pool is nice, warm, not too deep & saline rather than chlorine so it didn't burn eyes or make our hair icky.  The rooms are beautiful--a suite with sleeper sofa & king bedroom, fridge, microwave.  Our room was actually a handicap room & it seemed to be well-accomodating for that especially in the bathroom design.  We really enjoyed our stay here!

title: Service was great, but..........
review: My husbandd and i booked our honeymoon and stayed ther last week . We requested a sunset view room on a top floor, and was told '' no problem''  I called several times to confirm this and was told each time that i was all set. We did reiceve a sunset room, but it was on a low floor and the airconditioning system was right under us, and we could barely hear each other speak out on the balcony. [ did have great view though] We complained and the next day they moved us to the other side of the hotel. view was not as good, but at least the air conditioning was not under us.    We went out to rent some jet skis, and i agree with the other people that have mentioned it. That lady is RUDE!!!!!!!!    They said the water was to choppy and they weren't renting, so we took a stroll down…

title: Loved the DiamondHead!  Great family vacation!
review: My husband and I went down with our 2 kids ages 6 and 5.  We are from Boston and the kids were on vacation the week of Apr 16th.  There were many families but no too crowded at all.  We all had a blast!  The people at the hotel couldn't have been nicer.  Very accomodating and pleasant.  A big hello to Neal Sullivan from Cambridge - great guy.  The rooms were very clean and plenty big.  We had no problem with housekeeping at all.  Food at the pool was great.   No problem getting lounge chairs. Did not eat dinner there so can't comment on that.  We went out to eat at Charley's (twice!), Pinchers and Snug Harbor (OK).  We used our car everyday.  Took a trip to Captiva and Sanibel for shells.  All in all a great trip and would highly recommend.

title: Just OK, and Not Clean
review: My family (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed here Easter Week on Spring Break, on chose it based on the great reviews of other members here.  However, we found this "resort" to be just "OK", having both good and bad points.  The good qualities were: (1) it was right on the beach and (2) the rooms were decent sized, had an ocena view and had a refrigerator and microwave.  The bad qualities were: (1) housekeeping did a poor job cleaning and restocking toilet paper, towels, etc. (we had to call and ask more than once for room amenities that should have been washed, refreshened or replaced) and (2) the pool was overcrowded (they don't have nearly enough chairs, and guests were fighting about it).  Also, our pocket bathroom door was broken upon arrival, and we were told to either leave it…

title: Nice Stay
review: Spent 3 days on a quick vacation with my family, two boys 7 and 10.   Our first time to Ft. Myers beach.  We had no complaints.  Everyone at the hotel was lovely -very helpful and very accommodating.  The room was spacious and clean and very quiet.  Our room was oceanfront on the first level which was great.  At night my husband and I would escape to the lounge for a drink , which was right around the corner from our room, while the kids watched a movie.    We ate lunch at the pool everyday.  The food was good - loved the veggie wrap.  We did the dolphin jet ski tour with the onsight water sports company.  It was also wonderful.  We saw many dolphins and an American bald eagle.  Overall we had a wonderful time and would recomend the hotel to anyone.

title: A fantastic Holiday
review: My wife, myself, my 16 year old son and his 16 year old friend just returned from Diamondhead back to Ottawa, Ontario, Canada, from March break (March 9th - 16th).  The hotel is the best on the beach - first class all the way.  The boys kept themselves occupied evey day and night.  We drove down and that was probably a mistake as there is so much traffic on Estero Boulevard that we didn't use our vehicle once.  Rent a bicycle across the street and you can go anywhere.  The food at the pool was excellent - in Cloe's not as good but OK. Even though the hot tubs and pool are supposed to close at dusk the kids weren't bothered by the friendly staff and stayed there some nights until 2:00 AM - and it was nice to know where they were.  The hotel was actually quite quiet compared to…

title: Great family hotel
review: We booked this hotel with Virgin Holidays which only has one other hotel in Fort Myers so we weren`t sure what it would be like.  Firstly the rooms are enormous,we are British so perhaps they are not by US standards. Having two teenagers with us it was great to be able to shut the bedroom door to get some privacy & again the bed was gigantic. The kids had a large sofa bed in the living area to sleep on which obviously isn`t up to much but they are young & I am not! There is also a Kitchenette which was basic but adequate,a small table & chairs completes the picture. The balcony was also very big with great views along,in our case,Fort Myers beach to the South.Our friends were facing North towards the pier which was a slightly better view especially as the New Years Day fireworks…

title: Negative review, door would not lock
review: We stayed 4 nights, we were in # 1202, when we arrived our door would not lock, the next day, we told the desk and they sent someone to repair it, of course we were on our way out for the day, so we had to leave the room unlocked, when we arrived back several hours later he was still in our room, didn't speak english, he left but, left his cart in the way with his paint etc.  He did fix the door but, you had to wait for it to close on its own. Our 18 yr. old son had to take the sleeper sofa, it was not great we put several blankets on top the mattress to help.  We paid more to have a poolside oceanfront room, I think the gulfview would have been ok though.  I did see a silverfish in the drawer alive, our room wasn't the greatest.  I didn't like standing outside to catch the…

title: Awesome Hotel
review: Just got back from FMB.  This hotel was absolutely awesome.  We booked an ocean front room and actually got true ocean front.  We had a huge Screened in porch over looking the ocean.  The rooms were really spacious and had everything you needed for eating inside the room in the kitchenette (silverware, bowls, plates...etc).  They also had a mini fridge, a microwave and a dishwasher.  The staff was really nice and there was plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance.  It was our first time here in FMB.  I recommend going over to Sannibel island (less than 10 minutes away).  We went over there on two occasions.  We rented bikes and rode around in the reserve and on another day we rented a boat and at Jensons marina (tip of the Sannibel) and cruised the islands.  Very…

title: Great Place
review: We stayed at this hotel for our second week of vacation and wished we were there for the whole two weeks rooms are nice & roomy very clean staff was great and the bell man was very nice & helpful only problem was 4th of July by the pool alot of guests had family & friends at the hotel which was fine but you were unable to get a seat anywhere around the pool other then that a great vacation would go back again!!

title: The nicest resort on the beach!
review: My husband and I stayed here for one night after a night spent previously at a hotel down the road that came highly recommended to us.  The Diamond Head was quite the relief.  It was clean, accomodating, spacious rooms.  There were no bad smells, which seemed to be a common occurence for other hotels on the beach.  It is near everything.  Although it was more pricey than I prefer to spend, it was well worth the good nights sleep.  Our suite came with a full kitchen even with a dishwasher. We will definitely stay there again.

title: 5 relaxing days
review: Excellent hotel- home away from home-very clean-quiet- relaxing-good food -great service-  However overall- beaches on fort myers are full of seaweed-you will have to stick to the pool- if not too crowded-not many restaurants catering for vegetarians-except  Borritos a go-go-Topps supermaket-4 blocks from the hotel- carries a lot of frozen entrees "Amy's"-you can microwave in your room-otherwise we had a great time and weather was awesome!

title: Wonderful hotel!  Great view from room!
review: We booked an oceanfront room, and it was truly oceanfront!  If you stood in the room looking out, you could see nothing but water.  There was a large balcony overlooking the water and beach directly below.  The room itself was beautiful, clean, and very spacious.  Great location, also.  I wish we could have stayed more then the one night we did.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Very nice hotel
review: We recently stayed at Diamonhead, and loved it. The hotel staff were very nice and accomendating. The staff really make you feel welcome and are very sincere, which seems to have become  rare with customer service these days. The hotel is located within easy walking distance to Times Square, and everything to do in Fort Myers Beach. The rooms are very large and well kept. The balcony is huge. We would definetly recommend this hotel for a stay at FMB. Can't wait to go back!!!

title: Nice 'Marriott Style' Hotel
review: Definitely nicest (hotel) on Beach.  We were traveling with mentally handicap ladies, so we chose this hotel for several reasons.  First, the suites are clean and spacious.   Also, they were ajoined by a patio door, so easy to get to and from room to room.  The large pool area is also very clean .  The pool is very shallow, so the ladies were able to spend quite abit of time swimming.  Our only complaint would be that we found the hotel layout to be quite confusing.  In order to get to your room(s), you must go through the cabana bar or parking garage (our ladies would have never found their rooms alone).  Further, the exterior of the rooms offer cement floors (outdoors), which lead to be quite noisy first thing in the morning when maid service begins...carts must have metal…

title: Ft. Myers Beach Estero. Diamondhead resort-Great hotel-Oct. 2006
review: All suite hotel with a great beach (white sand) and a nice pool and all the amenities that a full service reasort  has. Rooms are all waterview. (We had oceanfront, very nice) Hotel staff very friendly and helpfull. Nice resturant, lounge and Tiki Bar that serves food also at poolside. Best hotel on beach.  Helpfull Hints-Contrary to some of the reviews that said the hotel food was expensive, we found that all the local resturants were priced the same and the food at the hotel was much better than two or three local resturants that we tried. If you eat at fast food chains that are in the area you can eat cheaper. The average entree in most of the popular resturants (which are all within walking distance from the hotel) vary from $16.00 to $30.00.  Shop for food items for your…

title: loved staying there
review: Stayed there for 2 nights. Arrived early without problems, got a room on the top floor-extremely nice view! We were sorry we had to go back to the east coast that soon! would love to stay there again!

title: Enjoyable weekend getaway
review: My wife and I stayed at the DiamondHead Resort on Fort Myers Beach for two nights on the last weekend in September. We found everyone at the resort very friendly and the staff was very helpful. We stayed in a beachfront 1 BR suite on the 11th floor and the view was magnificent. As we entered the living room, the curtains on the sliding glass door were open and all you could see was the ocean. It was as if it was right outside the door. We had the corner unit, so we were able to have a view of the city, sunset, and ocean. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were roomy and the shower was updated. Water pressure was awesome and the shower massage was the best I've had in any hotel/resort that I can remember. We spent most of our time at the pool which was very…

title: Great place on the beach
review: Stayed at Diamondhead Resort July, 2006.  This was a great place to stay right on the beach.  Wonderful views from balcony.  They do have screened in balconies, not so great for pictures.  However, the hotel was wonderful.  Rooms were spacious.  Nice pool with beach view.  Walking distance from Times Square and many restuarants and bars.  Can't wait to visit again.

title: Can't wait to go back...
review: We stayed on June 19th & 20th, the only thing wrong I found was the smell Alberto dredged up from the gulf the week before. Everyone assured us it normally was not  like that and that it would eventually wash away.   The staff were all super friendly and helpful and the grounds were very clean considering the storm. Our room was very clean and comfortable for the three of us, and when our son had an emergency with the plumbing maintenance was there in no time to save the day!   We used the parasailing offered for an additional fee, and found it well worth it. The captains were very accomodating and made the experience very memorable for our family.  Diamond Head was also a very short stroll from the pier so there were plenty of restauraunts,shops and things goings on.

title: Very Nice Hotel for the Price
review: This is the best hotel near the boardwalk area.  The rooms were clean and the beach wasn't crowded for June.  I really suggest families to stay her for the price because it's a good atmosphere.  Call hotel direct for better prices.

title: Great Place to Stay
review: In my opinion, this is the nicest property on Fort Myers beach.  Great location on the beach.  Large spacious rooms with huge screened balconies.  Parking was never a problem and was free.  The views from the gulf view suites are great.  Be sure to get a room that faces the west so that you can see the gorgeous sunsets.  The ocean front rooms are also nice but the gulf view rooms (those that face west) allow you to see the ocean/beach and the city.  We sat out on our balcony and did lots of sunset-watching.  We would definitely recommend this property.

title: Nice Place!
review: We stayed at the Diamond Beach for a week with our 2 boys aged 8 & 18 and found the resort good, for the most part.  Not a whole lot to do for fidgety kids - there's the pool and the beach, but no activities or game room, etc.  Lots of food and drinks available, but kinda pricey, although from the guests we saw, money is no object.  Rooms were fantastic.  Be sure to request beach front.  We had a room on the 11th floor above the patio/restaurant and pool and a couple of nights I had to get up and shut the patio door because there were some rowdies.  I just wanted to hear the surf, not yelling and loud laughing until 2 am.  We moved.  Lots to do in the area, however there were no great restaurants within walking distance.  Drove to the Crab Shack just over the bridge near the…

title: Not That Great
review: Me and my girlfriend just went down for a quick "Girls Lay In The Sun Have Fun & Relax" weekend.  After visiting Diamondheads Website it appeared to be the perfect place. We are both in our mid thirties and didn't want to deal with "Spring Breakers". (The Diamondhead does not allow anyone between 18-24 w/o an adult over 35).  Little did we know that every family with infants, small children & teenagers would be staying there.  They take over the entire pool area; out of the 4 days there we were only able to lay at the pool once.  If your not up by 7:00 - 8:00 to put a towel on a chair you don't get one.  Also we noticed that alot of people would put towels down and never use the chair; they would be in the pool with the kids all day.  Nor did they pick up after themselves around…

title: Fabulous, Luxurious Resort
review: From my experience everyone should stay here, I'm not sure why these few other people had it so rough, but it was a fantastic friendly place to stay!  My boyfriend and I stayed at Diamond Head Beach Resort Hotel on Fort Myers Beach in March 2006. I had never been to Fort Myers but was impressed that Diamond Head was the most beautiful of them all.  Our check in was as smooth as silk and we headed on up to our room on the 12th floor! Room 1201, FABULOUS view! The room was great, nothing too fancy, just right. Kichenette, Bathroom, Living Room, KING size bed, and a balcony that wrapped from the living room to the bedroom. We left the doors open every day and night so we could hear the ocean. The rooms were very clean and so was the rest of the resort.   The pool area is fantastic.…

title: To live in luxury while on vacation!
review: What a wonderful experience staying at Diamondhead!  Everybody is pleasant and helpful.  Rooms are great and the accommodations are teriffic! The pool is right on the ocean side and is well kept and has a friendly atmosphere. A newspaper at your room door every morning is a nice welcome touch.  Linnens are very nice and not on the cheap side. Diamondhead makes your stay at Fort Myers Beach well worth the trip and makes your vacation truely a pleasure.  They know how to pamper you.  Food is very nice both in the lounge and Chloes rest.  prices are reasonable and service is very good.  sitting on your balcony whether facing the gulf or overlooking the pool is relaxing.  Great place for couples, young families with kids and also the Sr. set.  There are chairs ,towels and umbrellas…

title: Great resort, just few minor probs
review: We stayed on the 7th floor out of 12, beachfront room.  Great view of beach and gulf.  Room was above avg quality, had a few nicks and scratches but overall in good shape and everything worked.  Staff was great, maid service great, loved the pool area, used the cabanas and chairs every day we could on the beach (extra charge for those).  Internet webpage price was better deal than going with any other source for us. The lighting in the entire hotel was too dark for us, especially the hallways which are very dark.  The room was comfortable and quiet for the most part, except for lots of fan noises from the restaurant when it was in operation, and noises from other balconies in the hotel.  We ate in the restaurant, Chloe's, once, and it was pretty good, quiet and romantic at…

title: Nice hotel, nice staff
review: We spent 5 nights at Diamond Head and had a wonderful time.  It is a solid hotel with a good location. Easy to walk to many restaurants which is a big plus given the gridlocked traffic.  When our first room was on a lower floor than we cared for (& the hotel booked solid on night #1 due to a conference) they were accomodating and moved us to a higher room for the next 4 nights.  Friendly and helpful staff.

title: great hotel
review: hotel was absolutely lovely. had great view of the sunset each night. the staff was very helpful. this is a great place for a family. each room is a suite with a king bed in one room and a pull out couch in the other. has a really large balcony overlooking the gulf.

title: Pros and Cons
review: These are condos and not a hotel.  So each room may vary.  The room we stayed in was a beach front/pool view room on the second floor (206). There is a wonderful view of the sun rise.  The pocket door handle between the master and the bathroom was broken and the bathroom sink did not drain.  The front desk had it fixed on our schedule and was very helpful.   The beach was very nice and easily accessible. However, you have to rent chairs & umbrellas if you do not want to use a pool towel to sit on.    The property had a bar & grill on site.  The service was good, the food below average.    The property had a restaurant.  The outdoor dining area overlooked the pool and ocean.  It seemed very nice, though we did not dine there, choosing to go out.    Fort Myers is a tired…

title: Lovely Hotel, But.
review: The Diamond Head is a first class hotel, the pool was very inviting, being as the air temp was 107, our apartment was very nice and clean, the air con worked very well, we were on the 8th floor with a gulf view and what a view, it was fab, the staff were very helpful and polite, it was nice to alternate between the beach and the pool being as they are within feet of each other, the hotel was a third full so it was a little quite while we were there. Now the but bit, while the hotel is nice, the area where it is :ie on Estero Drive is tacky,lots of burger joints,and cheap seaside shops, we had to go over the bridge into Fort Myers town to find a good eating place or eat at the hotel.

title: Local's Favorite
review: Before my family and I moved to Cape Coral Florida three years ago the DiamondHead was our hotel of choice, when staying here to visit my family. Now that we live less then ten miles away it's the perfect place for a a weekend get away and enjoy the sunshine of Southwest Florida.  It has two pool side hot tubs and a beautiful heated swimming pool. We can enjoy the hot tubs and keep an eye on the kids, while they swim. The beach is just a stones throw away and a beachwalk is always a fun adventure. The rooms have efficiencies and are very roomy. Each room has an enclosed balcony, so your little ones can play on them and you don't have to worry about them falling. You can feed the family in your room or eat at the restaurant or Tiki Bar. Many other restaurants are near by. It has…

title: Diamondhead - Nice Place to Stay
review: We just returned from four nights at Diamondhead. First off, I booked through the hotel and got a better deal.  We had a beachfront room with a spectacular veiw.  Bring binoculars -- saw lots of dolphin.  The room was very clean, with plenty of towels and a great showerhead.   AC was great.  Balcony was doulble-sized.  I got a deal thru the hotel with breakfast and drinks included.  The negative is the charge for beach chairs.  If it bothers you that much you could buy chairs and an umbrella and use it and then leave it for the maid.  They charge you for juice and coffee even though breakfast is included.   All in all it was a good time.  Ate at Biddle's restaurant and it was excellent with a bonus of a piano player that had a great singing voice. Also had dinner at Vincenzo's…

title: Diamondhead is the best !
review: Stayed 5 nghts at Diamondhead July 11- 16 ,  The hotel staff was very helpful and thoughtful. The rooms were large, clean and very nice. The balcony was very good size with a great view, we had oceanfront room. The pool was  nice size and very clean along with the hot tubs. The beach was great and very relaxing. Walked up and down the beach and did not see any nicer resort around.Did not see Pink Shell Resort so can not judge.We had breakfast at hotel which was ok, but nothing else, so hard to comment. Overall Great Hotel, Great Staff, Great Location and we had a Great Time.

title: Would recommend but wouldn't rave about it.  Overpriced.
review: The location of this resort is ideal. It's on the beach within walking distance of some good restaurants.  And from the looks of the other hotels on the main road, Diamondhead was the most impressive.  Ft. Myers Beach was teaming with spring breakers but our hotel was quiet, clean and full of couples and families.  The room was fine but I wouldn't say it was a good value -everything in Ft. Myers is insanely overpriced in high season. The view from the balcony was my favorite part.  The balcony is big and has a table and 4 chairs.  A nice place to unwind after a long day in the sun.   The service, however, left something to be desired.  Everyone from the bartender to the waitress in the restaurant had attitude and acted as if we all were a big inconvenice.  We've never really had…

title: Pros & Cons
review: We got into the hotel about 3:30 p.m. on June 30th 2005. We were Pleased with the room, though we did pay $40 extra a night for a total beach front view. The beach front/pool view room would have been just as good. Food was ok. Service left much to be desired. Probably short staffed, but I'm just being kind. Pool bar & grill close too early for vacationers! Grill at 6:00 & pool bar at 8:00. & they don't want you to bring your own food or drinks to this area after hours. Alot of kids at this time of year & alot of rowdy teen agers. Security is a contracted company & they don't much care about what goes on. Very loud parties at 3:00 a.m. with drinking & screaming. Front desk just decides not to answer the phone. We called, & alot of other guests called, nothing was done. …

title: A Wonderful Place to Stay
review: When we arrived at the hotel we were very excited because as we looked around we realized this hotel was in the perfect place.  The only negative thing we encountered was check in.  I had made my reservation through AAA and verified everything through AAA 5 days before our trip.  When I went to check in they did not have a reservation for us.  I was quite surprised and upset!!  They explained to me that they had notified AAA several weeks before that they had no extra rooms.  Diamondhead was quick to find a room for me and then gave us a complimentary bottle of wine for our trouble.  The fault with the reservation was with AAA.  I guess they only allot for so many rooms to be booked by AAA.   Our room was beautiful and clean.  Plenty of room for 4 people.  The bed was…

title: Excellent Hotel
review: I'm surprised to read the other reviews complaining about the cleanliness.  I found our room very nice and clean.  The price is a little steep, but for the money you're getting a 1 bedroom suite, screened in balcony with table/chairs, full kitchen w/ amenities, excellent view, great access to the beach.  The hotel has a nice restaurant (Chloes), lounge bar, and poolside bar.  We managed to score the best room in the hotel - 12th story corner room that had a great view of the gulf and sunset.   We did have some problems with Chloe's room service (not getting the food we ordered) but other than that, nice restaurant.  Compared to the other hotels on the beach, this is the nicest one.

title: Very Personable Service
review: I am happy to say this was by far our most enjoyable trip in years. The employees were incredibly friendly, the rooms were spacious and clean, the food was wonderful and the beach atmosphere was most relaxing. We will stay again next year.

title: Very disappointing hotel
review: My family stayed at the Diamondhead in May 2005, we were very disappointed with it, so much so we relocated 3 days into a 17 day trip. On arrival to our room on the second floor when exiting the lift we thought we had come out in the basement.  The walls are painted a murky brown and there is nothing to let you know what floor you are on.  The rooms themselves were ok, although we had to call reception daily to have our room cleaned.  We also had to call maintenance to fix the shower and for a plug for our bath.  All in all we weren't impressed with the hotel and certainly won't be staying there again.  I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Wwnt down hill.
review: They left,  left over room service food near elevator for over 24 hrs.

title: I paid way too much for a dirty room.
review: I am NOT a big fan of the DiamondHead.  I paid the price of $190/night and expected my money's worth.  Instead, I got a dirty room with outdated furnishings/linens and no internet service.  I expected a lot more for what they charged me.  On a postive note, it has a fabulous location on the beach, nice decks and seemed to have a nice pool.  The public areas were kept nice,  but the rooms (were you would spent the majority of your hotel time) were disgusting.    I definitely would not be back here (especially at the price!).

title: Great Location
review: Good hotel, in good location. Spent 4 days at end of April. Excellent sized room, kept clean and tidy. Restaurant fine, with good views over the beach.

title: Great hotel and location!
review: We just returned from a 3 day stay in Fort Myers.  We stayed at the Diamond Head Beach Resort, and we were very pleased with the hotel and the location!  It seemed like the nicest hotel/resort to stay on the beach.  We absolutely loved our screened in porch and the beautiful view of the pool area and Gulf.  It was nice to have breakfast on the porch and watch the sunsets. We spent time walking up and down the beach and it was very close to all of the shops and restaurants.  We even saw dolphins in the Gulf!  We would definitely stay at Diamond Head again. Sanibel and Captiva Island are worth the trip!  Check out Bowman's Beach on Sanibel Island, if you want a less-crowded beach.

title: Great Stay at Diamondhead
review: My wife and I just returned from a short 3nt. stay at the Diamondhead Resort. Nice rooms, Great beach and location. Excellent for long walks on the beach.  It's just close enough to be able to walk to what I would call the "spring break" type hotels where liveliness, loud music and partying is all day (and night) long.  But, just far enough away from the crowded beaches of those hotels and public beaches to enjoy a peaceful, quiet, day at the beach. Great place for kids too. ....We will probably take ours next time....Chloe's restaurant isn't all it's cracked up to be, but my expectations may have been too high. Excellent staff in the office, on the beach, and in the bar. If you go, ask for a west corner beachfront suite, it gives the best views of the sunset...We'll be back!!!

title: Mmmmmmmm!
review: It was the perfect place for us! Great suite, fab view, immaculate pool and very friendly staff. With two young children the pool area and activities arranged by the hotel (for a small fee) were truly great. And for the adults the pool bar (with super friendly staff) came very handy :-). My top remark goes to the house keeping team who were the friendliest i have come across.

title: Everything we hoped for and more.
review: We stayed at the Diamond Head the first week in Dec. 2004 for 7 nights and were so impressed; this is the only place we ever fully intend to return to on a regular basis.  My #1 requirement was a room with a balcony and great view on the gulf front; and what a view.  My husbands # 1 requirement was a great pool.  Neither of us was disappointed.  We had a corner suite on the 7th floor.  The balcony was the largest of any hotel we have ever stayed, encompassing both the living room and bedroom.  We had everything we needed in the suite.  Staff was excellent.  The hotel has by far the best location of any on the beach.    We found a supermarket across the street that sells very inexpensive fully cooked meals, which made a nice change from eating out.  We took the meals back to the…

title: Stay Here
review: We have been fortunate enough to be able to travel frequently..Probably have visited over a hundred hotels during the past twenty years or so..This venue easily ranks in the top ten..The room was very clean with comfortable furniture..Huge private balcony overlooking what they seem to believe is the cheap view..Don't pay extra for the full Gulf or Pool rooms..Stay on the north side with a direct look at the sunset and Sanibel Island..Very well located to visit Sanibel and Captiva Islands and a short drive to Naples..Large pool, and the Bar has some type of entertainment every night..We were very pleased with the service..The direct area is a bit tawdry,but there is an excellent Italian Restaraunt (Pappa Mondo's) nearby..Since we have friends in Naples, we will be returning to…

title: They put us in the Dungeon and we had a Long-Standing Reservation
review: The people who work at Diamond Head "All Suites" Resort Hotel in Fort Myers Beach, FL do not know what customer satisfaction means.  They just don't care.  We knew we wouldn't be able to check in until 1 a.m. and called twice days before our arrival to make sure that we would get a room on the 6th floor or above, because we were "repeat" customers and knew what we wanted.  They told us that rooms were designated the day before check-in and that they were putting a note on our computer reservation about our late check-in and they would reserve a room we wanted.  We got there and -- oh, my -- there was only one room left, which the front desk clerk took 20 minutes to find.  It was in the dungeon.  It was also a handicapped room, next to the kitchen fryolater vents, which gave off…

title: awesome view
review: We have been staying at Diamond Head since it opened.  Great place to relax and unwind.  Clean, spacious rooms and the ocean view is incredible from the private balcony.  We love it!

title: Great Location Quality Resort
review: Well after researching the area for a good location & reputation I found the Diamond head Resort 1/4 mile from FT Myers Pier but very quiet come sundown the Party place  was Lana Kai for fun.We found Lovers Key State par k very "secluded" went on a thursday and in a 3 mile stretch maybe 20 people that was very private sections :-)......food was so so in the area and had fun for on night on the BIG M  casino boat that was very nice and steady for our 10 mile excursion.

title: Would love to go back to this great resort!
review: We just got back from our week vacation at the Diamondhead Resort (June 1 - 8, 2004) and can not praise the hotel enough.  We had an ocean front suite which was beautiful.  I was amazed that the screened porch was perfect - absolutely no holes in the screen so we could keep the doors open all night.  We loved to sit on the huge balcony and look at the ocean.  The rooms were kept very clean and in all our stay was very enjoyable.  The room layout was excellent.  The staff was very attentive and quickly responded to any request. The pool area was very nice as was Cabanas, the beach bar.  The food was excellent as were the drinks.  The hotel is right on the beach which was fantastic and was within a short, very enjoyable walk by the ocean to the fishing pier and restaurants.  In…

title: Lovely sunsets, great staff.
review: Stayed Feb 24-March 2, 2004. Started with a poolfront gulf view. Nice room, but not very private. Upgraded to a beachfront with a side view of the pool. Gorgeous view. Staff was extremely helpful. David, the bellman was very helpful. Spike the bartender was also very accommodating as well. In fact, all the staff were exceptional at this resort hotel. Our rooms were well maintained by housekeeping throughout the stay. Pool was well maintained and a constant 85 degrees, and the two hot-tubs were set to different temperatures to prevent young children from overheating. If you stay here, tell them the Borland's from Austin, Minnesota sent you. Children activities started on Friday.  Workout room leaves a little to be desired, but all in all a great place to stay in Fort Myers Beach.…
